3.5
In an area like New Market, where there are so many restaurants for dining in, Scoop is one of the best restaurants for mouth-watering Ice-creams.  A legendary outlet recognized for their Ice-creams. Have tried their sizzlers too, but the dish is very bland and prepared differently. A very lively and brightly lit place with good seating arrangements. Would love to recommend their 'As you like it' ice-cream. One can select up to 3-5 scoops of their favourite ice-creams, with a choice of fresh fruits, dry fruits and flavoured sauces. Absolutely amazing ice creams are found here, especially when one can customize their own ice-cream. A must visit for ice-cream lovers.

2017-11-14 19:52:14
Agnimitra Roy
2899822
2.5
It's been quite some time since I visited this place(sorry to say, the pic isn't from the last time we went there). This is a nice place to opt for when you decide to splurge for some occasion but since I didn't taste their actual food, I can't really vouch for it. Over a span of several dates and birthdays, I've dropped in this place. The ambiance isn't too quaint but serene enough to enjoy a romantic date and also chic enough to crowd in the seats and spend the time with a group of people.

I've had their Cold Cafe Frappe, As You Like It, Pehla Nasha, some other cold coffee variants and 'scoop' offerings! Nothing is above average but the place is ideal over a scoop or two to scrape every other minute while you catch up with friends.

If you're famished, you can find better places in the vicinity but if it's to spend time with someone and you're near this place, don't give a second thought.

##

2017-11-12 19:31:20
Sagnik Bose
37972640
4.0
Located in the New Market area, this place is famous for their ice creams and deserts and for the right reasons.
While my visit there with my friend I ordered the Dark Temptation. A mix of chocolate and vanilla ice cream with brownie on the top can never taste bad. And the additional wafers are always appreciated. The brownie just melts into your mouth giving a hint of dark chocolate right before you dive in for the ice creams. I really enjoyed it and would definitely order this again sometime.

My friend had a Big Boy shake and it's one of those shakes that are presented so beautifully that you almost hesitate to destroy it by putting it in your mouth. But once you do it tastes absolutely amazing. While I had only a bit from my friend for tasting, I could tell by the way he was eating it that it was an enjoyable experience. 

The staffs were good and the ambience is also okay and nothing to complain on that front. 
So overall I really enjoyed my time here and would like to go back again sometime and recommend others to visit as well.

Taste wise also the the food was average. But if you are searching for an ice-cream corner in new market area you can visit this place.

2017-11-01 11:27:45
Soumita Raichaudhuri
38625844
3.0
Can't count the number of times I have visited this place owing to its location in New Market. Mostly crowded, the place is pretty loud for my choice. Average interiors. The butter masala dosa is good in taste and quantity. The biryani combo is a disaster though at the price. Special mixed fried rice was one dish I particularly liked  paired with chicken hot garlic. The mutton dopiaza and butter naan are nothing to go gaga over. And as for desert, I ordered a one called Love and Disaster- the love was so in disguise that all we saw was the disaster. Courteous but extremely late service from the staff.
At the prices charged, the service is surely wanting.
The only saving grace of the place is the Rosa which is value for money.

##

2017-11-01 10:26:55
SHALINI ChAudhuri
44018533
4.0
I loved this small parlor near new market area.It's really a good place with lots of combos and ice creams. I went there with my friends during pujo.Even at that time the quality served is good.We tried Chicken keema Dosa which is astounding great dosa I ever eaten.It became my instant favorite. Along with that I tasted chola batura which is good also.The combos I tasted were fried rice and chilli chicken. Its also pretty okay.But I feel the amount is quite less at that price. Servicing of the combos order required nearly one hour which is pretty irritating.Anyways,it's a good cozy place to satisfy your appetite.Don't think much and taste at least one dosa :) You'll love it!! *_*

##

2017-11-01 08:11:54
Pranjal Dey
33598599
2.5
Everything is overpriced. The food is not that good. Some of them come free with hair too. And when they change that item with a freshly made one i don't know how that same item turns out smaller in size. My friend had ordered a chicken keema dosa which contained a strand of hair. On complaining they changed the dosa but somehow it turned out smaller in size. Not like he had consumed a big chunk of the initial order too. Moreover the keema was filled with ground bones. Maybe that comes complimentary too.
We had also ordered French fries with cheese and chicken. The same problem with the chicken. I don't know where they get their chicken keema from. But maybe the management doesn't know that bone free chicken keema is readily available in the market. In fact that is the only sort of chicken keema found unless you shove a whole chicken into a mixer grinder and grind it. The fries were half burnt and the cheese....we had to dig up the cheese buried inside the dish.
The only dish worth mentioning was the Aglio Olio. A bit oily but it is prepared with olive oil so not unhealthy entirely. The pasta was perfectly boiled and al dente. The dish was well seasoned too.
I'm sure everyone who has visited New Market has seen this place at least once therefore i did not bother writing about the location. However the staff is quite friendly here and helpful although half of the time they are missing.

##

2017-10-16 01:17:28
Dwaipayan Chakraborty
35453470
3.5
Visited this place almost near to their closing hours after a long walk from sealdah to esplanade. The place was pretty empty. Ordered an Ice cream float and a Pehla Nasha ice cream. The float was delivered wrong and upon informing they changed it promptly. The Pehla nasha ice cream stole our hearts the moment it arrived. Both the looks and taste of the ice cream was good. 
The ambience of this age old shop has also improved a lot after they revamped it. Particularly the numerous mirrors and the cute cat watches add a special zing to the place. Cash and card accepted. Nice place to visit when in the esplanade area...

##

2017-10-02 20:01:09
Angellena Sarkar
36165508
3.5
Located in the heart of New Market, this is one of the restaurants which is busy n filled all round the year. It has got a wide range of cuisine and menu to choose from which makes it a great public attraction. The interiors are decorated with pretty pinks n lights, perfect for kids. Visited on a Saturday afternoon and had to wait for 10mins before we got our table. Ordered a few dishes. The first being fish in garlic butter sauce, which was served with mashed potatoes and very cute garlic bread. The next up was the mutton thali, with mutton curry, tandoori roti and raita. The quantity of this particular dish was disappointing. Next up was the kebab platter which was reshmi kebabs and herb rice, both of which lacked salt to my taste. The last dish of the day was lamb sizzler, which was a clear winner among the rest. The meat pieces were well cooked, soft n succulent, served with a portion of herb rice. The rice and the gravy complemented each other. Then we tried their shakes, strawberry and dark forest shake to be precise. The dark forest shake had crumbs of cake  in it, both of which was served with whipped cream n cookies. Would visit again to try cuisines maybe.

##

2017-09-29 22:47:23
Kaushik Ghosh
37286358
1.5
It was on the occasion of Durga puja night that me and my wife chose to go to a less crowded restaurant to try out continental cuisine.... we ordered fish finger...it was served with crispy chips n mustard sauce..pretty good to start on with..in addition to that we took fresh lime soda..besides this we ordered fried chicken in Thai chilli basil sauce-utterly disappointing that was over fried and it was sooo salty that we could not had more than one each...on complaining ,the waiter suggested to take it as parcel instead of replacing it. Next came the main course which comprised of grilled fish in butter garlic sauce,mixed veggie n lemon rice- the same problem persisted ...we cald upon the waiter and told him strait that even the latter dish was also too salty to eat..the waiter instead of solving the problem..started making arguments that it was not possible that both the dishes could have the same problem...it spoilt our puja night... probably would never visit again...very disappointing indeed!!

##

2017-09-06 14:06:46
Ayantika Bhaskar
16188567
3.5
Visited this popular kitschily decked restaurant in the afternoon after a shopping spree at New Market. Interior is decorated with a riot of colors, bird cage, owl on a tree branch, paper dragonflies from ceiling, watering can sprouting flowers, pictures etc.
We had the Love & Disaster, which came in a boat-shaped glass dish on a dainty doily and adorned with a pretty paper umbrella. The dessert item consisted of three ball-shaped scoops of Blind Love ice cream, drizzled with chocolate sauce and garnished with two chocolate wafers, cashew nuts and topped with a red cherry. It tasted well, enough for two people to indulge in some sweet affair.
For lunch and exquisite-looking desserts and shakes a good choice in the area.

4.0
It was one of my favourite places, until today. The justification of 4* is that this place has always made me happy in the past. There was a Mango festival going on when I happened to visit Scoop the last time and the two dishes that I ordered were absolutely amazing. With the same expectation I visited today, but alas! I was let down. The place is always too crowded but today even the staff was too busy.

We ordered the following:

Tik Tok Murg: Plain chicken tikka on the mint sauce.

The Majesty: A regular chicken biryani.

Puppy Love: It was as expected and nothing extraordinary. Scoops of ice-cream with whipped cream and gems.

Divine Chocolate: It was supposed to be a best seller but unfortunately the last was just too ordinary. There was nothing divine about the chocolate cake and even the dish was not very clean.

Overall it's a good place but today it was not the Scoop I always admired.

From here on, began my mind-numbingly long and tedious wait for the main course. During the course of nearly another half an hour, I sat and starved and was border-line ignored by the waiting staff during my repeated enquiries about the remainder of my order.  At around 9:30, I was forced to call the waiter and ask for my  bill on what I have consumed as it was getting late. The waiter checked and informed me that they had not even registered my order of Thali Style, let alone convey it to the kitchen! 
This has to be a new mile-stone in poor quality of service. Thanks a lot Scoop for ruining my evening and wasting an hour of my life.

##

2017-08-31 19:30:44
Priyanka Ghosh
30538473
3.5
Today visited this restaurant for lunch in New market area after a tiring shopping. It was around 2.30 pm and the place was almost full. The dining area was quite big with nice decorations. Our today's food journey includes,
* Starter : Chicken Nuggets
* Main Course : Biriyani with Chilly Chicken Combo
* Drinks : Pepsi
The service was quite fast. The food arrived altogether in a few minutes. Firstly the Chicken Nuggets tasted as usual good. 8 PCs of Nuggets were served with chips. Biriyani and chilli chicken combo also tasted decent. Biriyani was just simple and chilli chicken was good. 6 PCs of chicken was served in the combo. Quantity was more than enough for feeding single person. Only one thing that I didn't like at all they served the biriyani and chilli chicken together in a bowl, so that the gravy was all mixed up with the rice. It would be better if they serve the biriyani and the chilli chicken separately. Otherwise the foods were pretty good. Prices were on higher side. They also charged 18% GST on the total amount. Our bill for two persons was 791 RS. You can give it a try once.

A definite 1‚≠êÔ∏è for this place, keep it up üëçüèΩ

##

2017-08-31 13:29:16
Debalina Mukherjee/thathungrytraveller
2515676
4.0
This cafe cum dessert parlour is located in the busy streets of New Market area. It's crowded almost all the time due to the location. Whenever I go for shopping at Esplanade I manage to drop in here. The desserts here are to die for. I order Banana split, Moon rocker which gives 3 scoops of butterscotch and one scoop of vanilla ice cream with chocochips, chocolate sauce and nuts. The mocktails are also nice here. You can get a whole variety of cuisines from Vada pav to Chinese and Mughlai. I ordered Crispy chili babycorn and chicken cutlets. I have also had Puri and bhatora. The food is very tasty and the portions are huge. But this place is a little pricey but the food is worth it anyway. The ambience is very colorful and vibrant. It's spacious and won't take much time to get a table. The service is prompt. If you haven't yet visited this place, this recommendation is for you.

2017-08-19 11:17:23
Sulagna Mukherjee
31998332
3.5
Scoop is a restaurant situated in near New Market area beside Domino's. The interior decor of this restaurant is really very nice and the seating arrangements and the background music is good. The restaurant serves amazing sundaes and ice-creams and shakes along with main course foods.

Now coming to the food. We have ordered for-

1) Jap Chicken and Noodles combo ( It was good in taste. Nothing extra ordinary and the proportion of food is good for one)

2) Barbeque Chicken Sandwich ( I personally did not like this sandwich. The Barbeque sauce was so runny and the chicken pieces were a bit smelly, chewy and felt like they were stale)

3) Cr√©m√© brulee flavoured ice cream( I loved the way they presented that one scoop of ice-cream in a small tea cup and a chocolate wafer stick. The ice cream was good)

4) First Love ( It was also an ice cream scoop and tasted of caramel and chocolate with small pieces of nuts. I liked this one also)

5) Kit kat shake ( Lovely presentation. I am sorry to say but this was so bad in taste. I felt like I was having some bitter chocolate flavoured water. I doubt whether there was any milk in that milkshake and the only good thing about this is the presentation and those two little small pieces of kitkat)

Service is slow and staffs are courteous but unprofessional in behaviour. We have to ask for water several times as they don't serve water unless you ask them too. Food quality and taste nothing much worth mentioning. Ice-creams are the only good things here. Hope to visit there someday to grab a scoop of some good ice cream.

##

2017-08-18 19:34:12
Sudipto Roy
297419
4.0
The food is great. The service is very good. One needs to wait a bit but I can safely say that the food is veery FRESH. We ordered:

Sweet baby corn
Chicken Hakka noodles
Masala Pepsi
Chocolate ice cream

Have to say each item was prepared very well without being too much spicy or blunt. The Hakka noodles stands out amongst the lot. Very smooth and fresh noodles and vegetables with chicken and egg. What I liked most was soy sauce was subtly used in the noodles. Many restaurants uses too much soya sauce which kills the taste overall. The sweet and spicy corn was excellently cooked with a tangy taste. The masala Pepsi was just pespi and JAL jeera but went well overall with the food. A special mention about the ambience..someone did a good job with this. Many thanks

2017-07-03 18:33:04
Prerana Paul
41456280
4.0
Shopping is a tiring task and there's no place to go better than Scoop when hunger strikes amidst all the bargaining at New Market! The place is as colourful as possible and you'll never find it empty (at least I never did!). They nearly serve everything! From pizza to biriyani. So whatever you want to have, they will definitely have it in their menucard. 

I'm a fan of their milkshakes and desserts. The kitkat shake looks lovely but doesn't taste as great as it looks. The burnt onion with chicken curry combo is good and the quantity is more than sufficient for a single person. I've tried their chicken bharta which tastes great but the quantity is not enough for two people. 

To sum up, this place has always been my go-to place whenever I go for shopping at new market. Drop in to quench your thirst or end your hunger with your shopping bags!!

##

2017-07-01 10:28:19
Subhashree Sarkar
35978669
4.5
This is the best place to eat out after shopping at New Market. I wonder how I had missed this one earlier despite being a regular in that area.

Location- Beside KFC, Opposite Shreeram Arcade

Interior-
Very well decorated, with colourful lights. Pleasing ambience. We were lucky enough to visit this place when the ground floor was full due to the Eid Rush at New Market, and were taken upstairs. The first floor is an even more calm place, with light-lined glass walls, so that you can see the outside clearly.

Food-
the Continental Cuisine is great here. A huge menu. We ordered:
1. Royal Treat Pizza (regular): The size was decent enough and the pizza was so soft and tender, laden with cheese. Even the sides were mellow, which you don't get at Dominos. The Pizza was served on a wooden utensil.
2. Stuffed Chicken: This was a pure delight. Stuffed with great fillings and served with mashed potatoes and vegetables, it is great to serev two as a side dish.
3.Pehla Nasha: We were just planning to try a dessert and this one's name was attracting us a lot. It is a creamy pastry with milky cream on top and two dollops of yummy ice cream on both sides. What came as a huge but pleasant SURPRISE was that the dessert was served alongside a sparkler candle which sparkled for just a few minutes( fortunately).

Facilities- Free Wifi

2017-06-30 22:59:19

4.5
Scoops is an all time favorite, located at the heart of New Market. We come here often to grab a quick bite or kill some time. Everything ranging from the food to the ambiance to the service, is praiseworthy. The place is quite spacious and can accommodate a lot of people on a busy day. The staff is polite and quick at what they do, haven't faced any rude or indecent behaviour till date. The menu has a lot to choose from and the food is worth every penny spent. We ordered a Chocolate Milkshake, Cold Coffee, Chilli Babycorn, Creamy Baked Fish and Grilled Chicken with Mashed Potatoes. These were good choices on our part and we enjoyed our food throughout. Standard bill for two people - 1k approximately. Looking forward to come here again very soon.

##

2017-06-21 13:17:56
Avirupa Basu
37871044
3.5
We sneeked off to Scoop for a quick lunch sometime back. The interiors are quite funky, with colorful decor and interesting pictures and quotes on the walls. The menu is also very innovatively designed with cool names and a mix and match of delicacies. 
We ordered chhola bhatura, uttapam, chicken ala king, naan, mutton korma and milkshakes( oreo and butterscotch). The uttapam was yummy. It was very well made, soft and tender. The chhola bhatura was great too. Two huge bhaturas with ample quantities of spicy chhole and pickle made us all very full but then the chicken ala king came and that was amazing too. It was creamy and delicious. The rice and the chicken blended very well together.
Now comes the bad news. The mutton korma was BAD! It wasn't cooked properly, the mutton was hard and the spices hadn't blended together at all. Similarly, the milkshakes tasted pretty mild. The oreo one was just biscuity and the butterscotch one too bland. The service is rather slow and they take at least an hour to bring all the food to the table. But it is pocket friendly. To sum it up, a quick snack at a reasonable price is what this place stands for.

2017-06-11 22:03:33
Joyeeta Chakraborty
31670732
3.5
Scoop is a hidden gem among the hustle bustle of New Market. Known to most college goers, this place has variety of things to offer. Starting from milkshakes to oriental to south indian to pastas pizzas sizlers and what not.
Stays packed most of the time, and because of this mad rush sometimes orders get delayed. Moving on to the food, on my first visit I had a black forest milkshake and spicy garlic noodles. My friends had kitty mat milkshake and oreo milkshake. The milkshake was too good and at the bottom of the jar, there was a piece of cake soaked in chocolate sauce!
Their beverages are really worth a try.
Next, the noodles were okay, nothing great. The chilli was a bit on the higher side which killed the taste of it. Even the quantity was an issue.
Hence, if you'relooking for a place to grab a refreshment or a quick bite whilst shopping at new Market, Scoop might do you justice.

I ordered for birthday cake milkshake, boss lady-mix pink sauce pasta and three scoops of make your own sundae. We were asked to wait for 15 to 20 min for our order, we received milkshake after around 30 min and the pasta took 15 more minutes after that. And we lost track of time waiting for our sundae and the bill. I paid the bill via Paytm and they made us wait 10 to 15 mins after that just to check their Paytm balance, according to them which they did not receive. Finally they took my contact number and picture of my SMS from Paytm and released us. This was heights of wasting a consumers time and taking the test of patience.
Never ever going back there for food! I could get better food and better service in the same area at that cost.

2017-04-20 15:19:35
Debolina Chaulay
36906618
3.0
When you are hell tired after having a shopping spree at New Market,you can go to Scoop,a multicuisine restaurant where you can get anything and everything from sandwich,burger,pizza ; noodles,fried rice,manchurian to polao,biryani,vada,dhosa.

We ordered chicken a la king,vegetable polao and chicken butter masala,garlic nun and kadhai paneer.We had to wait for quite a long time.And my creative friend made that time productive by decorating the plates with sauce.well you all can see that in the pictures below. :)

I was so hungry,and that chicken a la king felt like heaven in the mouth.But then,when I've almost finished half of my plate,I saw a hair in it. The server was called and she brought another guy with her.And the guy said that they were extremely sorry for the hair fiasco.They took the old plate and brought me a new plate.This time I was a little sceptic about the food.But,thankfully,there was no hair. :P But the dish tasted yummy.The smell of cheese did increase my appetite.

The vegetable polao was good.I will definitely recommend this to others.Chicken butter masala was alright.

Kadhai paneer was good.Garlic nun was okayish,not as good as expected.

The desert looked great but I found nothing except a dollop of whipped cream and a liquidy substance.

All in all,the experience was good.The staffs were courteous.

2017-03-11 09:50:19
Chandni Chakraborty
27089110
4.5
Scoop does not needs an introduction in a different way. It is a place where you will find everything to eat be it Indian, Chinese, Continental or Mughlai. Since when I was introduced to Scoop by one of my friends, I always tried their chicken keema dosa, which is out of the box & obviously tasty. I never thought of trying anything else. But recently I went their with my friend & tried their continental part of menu & I must say they almost excel in that also. CHUMP CHAMP CHICKEN GRILL, a treat to your taste buds, creamy, succulent chicken in that extremely yummilicious sauce with sauted vegetables & buns. Ending with the dessert, LEE LING BROWNIE WITH PEANUT BUTTER, one of its kind of dessert, treat for your eyes & tongue, both.

##

2017-03-01 19:44:51
Sujata Thaker
30203195
4.0
Very colourful interiors....Once you step into the restaurant you are bombarded with bright colours from all sides. It adds to the informal and peppy atmosphere. The service staff are good, our server was Sangita and she went about her work smilingly and pleasantly. She even gave her suggestions about which icecream to have but in a gentle and mild manner, not overly aggressive but gently persuasive. Waiting time after the order was given was also moderate. Had paneer tikka and it was good, soft and succulent paneer pieces with tandoori masala and cooked well in tandoor with slightly charred edges giving it a smoky flavour. The pudina dip which accompanied it was tangy and tasty. The onions salad too added to the taste. The icecream, new one, strawberry cheesecake was excellent. 
But I feel that this place is somewhat overpriced. 
Otherwise good place.

4.0
If you are shopping at New Market throughout the day and you are tired and hungry, Scoop is the place to go. I've been here twice and even though the place is crowded and the service isn't quite fast, the food and desserts will completely satiate your hunger.
Ordered a cheese dosa, which was overloaded with cheese. 4/5. The KitKat shake is really delicious. What I really loved was this ice cream by the name As You Like It. It has 5 different flavored scoops, real fruits and wafers as toppings and is amazing. A must try.

2017-02-12 14:38:13
AVERY BANERJEE
34793859
3.5
I've been to this place a lot of times. The service is usually slow but the food is good and affordable. They have launched a new item, Creamy Baked Fish. On the whole, it's a nice dish. A thick fillet of fish well baked and topped with mozzarella cheese. It's served with roasted broccolis, potatoes and onions. A dash of lime in the potatoes would have made a world of difference. The palate became a little boring at times. I would like to make a special mention of Ms. Sanju Singh who was extremely courteous and went out of her way to make the visit memorable unlike my past experiences at the restaurant. I also tried the blackforest milkshake. It was not extraordinary,but  it was good.

2017-02-10 12:36:06
Sthita Prangya Mohanty
37114848
4.0
The New Market Area, the shopping hub has always been crowded with the fashion lovers. But, the place is quite popular among the foodies too and if you‚Äôre one among them, Scoop can be your pick. This is a perfect place to relish multiple cuisine; from South Indian to Chinese; from North Indian to Italian. Besides, a wide range of luscious desserts is there to be selected from. 

Last time, I went there to get some quality time with my dear buddies and had Chicken Sizzler, Chicken Salad and BB Chicken Burger. The Chicken Sizzler was a must have preparation that you would like to relish again and again. The salad was a perfect blend of lettuce and onion along with chicken tikka. Quite naturally, the taste of the dish was ravishing and state-of-the-art too. In addition, the burger, which was simply yummy, deserves complete appreciation. The grilled chicken was perfectly mixed with the mouth-watering BBQ sauce and the delicious cheddar cheese. The flavor and daintiness offered by the melted cheese totally mesmerized me.

2017-02-01 15:49:41
Bikash Burnwal
15743657
4.5
In spite of being the heaven for the ice cream lovers the Scoop of New Market also performs a prominent duty of keeping the taste-buds of everyone happy by serving delicious dishes. The place is a bit crowded, but all the waiting will actually come out to be beneficial after having a bite of their unique cuisine. Our last week‚Äôs visit to this awesome place actually became fruitful due to the variety of dishes served in the outlet. 

The ambiance of the food parlor was absolutely brilliant and the nice background  music of the place goes perfectly well with their marvelous food items. The dishes we decided to try consisted of chicken sizzler, chicken salad and BBQ chicken burger. The freshness of the lettuce and onions could easily be felt with every bite of the Chicken Salad we had. The pieces of the chicken used in making the salad were quite big. The BBQ Chicken Burgers we ordered were also very delicious. The chicken used in making the burger was perfectly grilled and the BBQ sauce, paprika, and cheddar cheese used in the burger made the dish more delicious. The Chicken Sizzler was also a mention worthy dish. 

The affordable price along with the wide range of food items are enough for the people to pick the outlet as a cool hangout place with their pals.

I know you are running a business but don't fool people like this because we come enjoy food and ambience so we pay.... That doesn't mean that you will fool us this way.... Really disappointed with their service.... Otherwise they have great food and awesome ambience.... I like visiting there almost everyday.....

##

2017-01-20 02:37:36
Devlin Chanda
1415183
3.5
Second visit here. Quite crowded, expected when you're bang in the middle of New Market. Known for its desserts but didn't try any.

Ordered the chicken cheese burger. OK. Served not with French fries but with the home made potato chips. The burger could have done with a bit more molten cheese, since the patty was dry. But it was tasty, and gets you full.

Chicken nuggets were really good. Soft, succulent. Fish fingers were disappointing. This is one dish I have everywhere I go, and this was too dry. Also, they don't serve it with tartar sauce, so another drawback that. Only reason I'm rating it 3.5 instead of 4.

##

2017-01-06 19:25:02
Souvik Maity
31980765
4.5
The visit to SCOOP was the result of a very sudden planning. Standing amidst new market we surfed zomato for a nearby place to have our lunch.. And scoop unexpectedly happened to us and more unexpectedly left us awe-stricken with what it had to offer. 
The first thing which hit us and for which the restaurant stands out is the ambience.. Just awesome. There is something very innocent, soothing and refreshing about the ambience. The interiors are very beautifully decorated with thermocol art. There is pinkish hue in the interiors created by the lights renders the place a childish attitude. The awesome music also adds to the beauty of this place. 
Next coming to food they have a pretty interesting menu card at least the new anglo indian section to be precise. They have added  a lot of innovative continental dishes in this new section. We ordered - 
UNCLE DENZIL MUTTON STEAK (from the new anglo indian potluck menu) - slightly gravy mutton steak served with mashed potatoes and vegetables. The mutton was soft and juicy. Tasted awesome. Even the mashed potato was tasty. 
INDONESIAN CHILLY NOODLES WITH CHICKEN SATAY (from the old menu) -  noodles served with 4 pieces of kabab-like fried chicken. Very innovatively delicious. 
FROZEN COCO- SCOOP is famous for their desserts. And this item does justice to their fame. This is also one of their new additions and most importantly comes at a very cheap rate. Consists of layers of cream with  a cherry on top with ice cold coco beneath. A perfect happy ending to an awesome meal.
Now regarding the pocket pinch,  I found SCOOP to be very much pocket friendly. The portions they serve is for one person and not adequate for sharing. But still considering the quality it is way more reasonable than other joints in the city and that too being located in the heart of kolkata. More importantly they DO NOT CHARGE THE EXTRA SERVICE CHARGE. That is a relief for sure. 
Once i learnt that  often the greatest pleasures comes in the most unexpected ways. Scoop just set a perfect example for that!! 
Bon apetit

245725
4.0
This nicely decorated place is located opposite of Sreeram Arcade and just beside the New Empire.
They have a tons of different items on their menu from Indian to Chinese to continental and Italian and what not and also there are varieties of desserts and shakes.The ambiance at this place is quite noisy but the interiors which is mostly in pink colored theme is impressive.

We Ordered : Mixed Grill Sizzler with rice and Big Boy Shake.

WE had to wait about 15 minutes for our Sizzler to come.But,it was worth waiting for the
dish.It consisted 1 piece of fish,1 piece of Mutton And and a large chunk of Grilled Chicken,served with rice and a Sunny side up egg.It was really delicious and a must try dish for all.
THEN it was the time for the shake.It came with 2-3 scoops Vanilla and 1 scoop of chocolate ice cream served in a dark chocolate layered glass jar with full of cream and a Brownie on top.Also 
it was decorated with 3 pieces of ferrero rocher and colorful Gems and a cherry on top.
The shake was insane and wonderful.

We had to pay Rs-716/- for these two dish and yes they did charge additional taxes.
¬†
The staffs were friendly but sometimes they were slow and didn't pay attention to the client.
I will visit again because of the food, which was good and also for the desserts.........

Food is par excellence here. We ordered milkshakes; each flavour was mouthwatering and extremely filling later we ordered French fries, a non masal dosa and a cardimum tea. The tea needs a special mention not only for its splendid taste but also for the salty savories that came along with it. This dreamy place becomes all the more better with the service that it offers. The service providers are extremely warm and enthusiastic. A special mention to Sanju Singh. She is a sweet heart and this review is also a shout out for her. I hope she gets to read it. A place worth going back and quite rightly placed under the legendary section of Zomato.

2016-10-30 10:09:33
Vivek Saini
113381
3.0
I've often passed by this place,  since it's situated at the heart of a bustling new market area. I believe the interiors have recently been re-done. It looks more like a flashy,  fancy joint for kids with all the vibrant colours. Huge menu,  though I'm not sure if everything is available. When I visited,  sandwiches were unavailable. We ordered penne in tangy tomato sauce and a plate of fish and chips. The food tastes good,  without any doubt. However the saddest part of the whole experience has been the staff. I hate to say this,  especially when I see how the serving staff is normally overworked in restaurants. But this was a cold treatment on a whole new level. Within a min. of occupying our table,  a guy comes to us for order. Like,  seriously? Then he asks us if we wanted a regular or bottled water. Upon asking for a regular one,  he gives an extremely weird smile (as if almost saying : bah! Regular weirdos,  can't afford a thing). Please note,  it's not just me, my friend felt the same as well. Then within,  3 mins. Another person comes for order and we hadn't even gone through have the menu. After this we really had to crane out necks out and call someone to place an order. Apparently,  the staff wasn't even aware if the  sandwiches are grilled or not. All in all,  we got a bill of Rs. 480 approx. I'd certainly not wish to go back to such a cold treatment. I could've rated lower,  but I really appreciate the chef's work. I wish the management reads this review and makes some improvements.

I went to Scoop a month back. Thanks to Zomato,  who supplied me with a food coupon from this place. And thanks again, as it was a wonderful experience. ##

2016-10-09 16:25:09
Amrita Mondal
36255179
5.0
Firstly, it's a place from kolkatan dessert legend. Secondly, this is where you go to chill out - literally and metaphorically. This is the ultimate hang out with friends,the more the merrier. Thirdly, there is a wide range of cuisine to choose from - sumptuous sizzlers to sassy south Indian.
My personal favourite is the famous slurpy Cantonese mixed noodles and fish. Their pizzas will put the current international brands to shame with the sizeable portions, generous toppings and fulfilling mouthfuls of cheese. North Indian dishes are great too. Momos are yummy. Every item is palate pleasing.
The place is spacious and the decor is unobnoxiously funky, done up by the proprietress . The setting is inviting for a mega gossip session with friends and family. The place is surprisingly affordable as well, even though it is a part of kolkata's hospitality history. Kids to grannies - there is something for everyone. A spiderman positioned outside on an English park bench has been the photo companion of numerous visitors from India and abroad.
The place has always been a dessert haunt so I am not writing much about the desserts. Remember, it is one of the first sundae-serving parlours in kolkata. So go and scoop some definitely after a hearty meal. This is not a place to visit in a hurry. It is a place to relax and enjoy, gossip and eat.

2016-10-06 10:07:51
Kolkata Epicurean
9516701
4.5
Location-New market area,Kolkata.

Have crave for freak shakes or icecream fusions?Then scoop is the place to satisfy your desire.Scoop is one of the oldest and legendary restaurant of Kolkata.Few years back it was only known for its sundaes but now this place is like an all rounder cricketer which is also famous for its shakes and food.You will usually find this place crowded and during pujas  you have to wait in cue to reserve a seat in this restaurant.It has two outlets in the city and serves Italian,Chinese,North Indian,Continental and South Indian cuisines.And during festive season they always have a special menu along with regular menu.

Service-The service at this place was extremely fast and reliable.The staff is too cooperative and helpful.Inspite of such a heavy crowd they served us the whole order in 10-12 minutes which was quite impressive.

Ambiance-The ambiance at this place is quite noisy but the interiors which is mostly in pink colored theme is impressive.It also has a two floored huge seating capicity.

Food-The food at this place is fingerlicking.And only one question was constantly striking our mind and it was"How so cheap?."This place also serves a huge variety in food and now during pujas in their special menu they are serving freak shakes which is served by extremely limited restaurant in kolkata.We had-
1:Masala idly
2:Big mama
3:Chola bhatura 
4:Veg seekh kebab

All the item were great in taste but the presentation of "BIG MAMA"just blew our mind.

Food-4.5/5
Service-5/5
Ambiance-4/5

A visit to this place is highly recommended especially if you are a dessert lover.üòÉüòÉ

##

2016-09-17 17:00:32
Shamayita Sen
3150383
4.0
Well, how to start this uniquely special review!! Am just so excited. First of all, a big THANK YOU to team Zomato, you people define awesomeness. It was around June and I was busy preparing for my final semester examination. I distinctly remember the day -  I was thoroughly bored and was waiting for something exciting to happen. My phone beeped as I received a notification from Gmail. To my utter surprise the mail was from Zomato! I was asked to give my personal address and phone number. In return they promised to give me a nice surprise! My day was made and I began to anticipate as to what's on store for me! The very next day I received a letter just to find a voucher inside it. Zomato offered me a free meal in Scoop which I needed to avail before 15th September. That was my butterflies in the stomach moment! ;) 

On the very last day that is on 15th September I went to Scoop. Its located on the ground floor of the New empire building at New market, opposite to Wow Momo and Dominos. Blame my superbly hectic schedule for the delay. Initially, I was a bit jittery for I had never ever gone to dine alone. As instructed, I called the restaurant up and confirmed reservation. I was there within 10 minutes of making the call and was greeted by a lady with a very warm smile. Within minutes a young guy approached me with a large menu card and I was literally starving. I ordered JAP CHICKEN, SPAGHETTI WITH MEATBALLS, DARK TEMPTATION AND PEPSI. 

JAP CHICKEN- 8 small pieces of succulent boneless chicken in a unique sauce. The dish was very spicy but not hot! Just the way I like it. 

SPAGHETTI WITH MEATBALLS - this dish was pretty disappointing. While the quantity was impressive the taste was not! It was way too tangy and failed to impress my taste buds. Blame dollops of tomato ketchup for the same. Meatballs were small but spicy. Likeable. This dish needs improvement, but.

DARK TEMPTATION - Ah! This one was a clear winner. Heard a lot about their ice creams and trust me I will go back again exclusively for this. It was a unique concoction of Vanilla ice cream, Chocolate ice cream, chocolate sauce and almond. An absolute delight for all ice cream lovers. I took my own sweet time to relish this delicacy and boy! I was just so content. 

SERVICE - Staffs are amazing and courteous. They are pretty attentive and responsive, which is a bonus! They are also very well trained and are experts in managing crowds. 

OVERALL EXPERIENCE -  Good. Totally Recommended. Oh! I loved the ambience. A tiny fairy land in the heart of an ever busy Esplanade!

2016-09-09 12:41:03
Akash
29069086
4.0
Scoop is a must visit Restaurant in New Market Area..I have visited there several time during my childhood when I went to New Market with my parents during puja shopping‚Ä¶.I was mainly a good dining place for those people who went New Market for shopping, but after their renovation u can consider it as a dating place also‚Ä¶
Location : It is very easy to find in New Market, located into the bottom floor of New Empire building just beside of WOW! Momo and KFC.
Decoration : After their renovation they added very much Pink in their shop..Very well decorated, big space, clean and no question left for the hygiene level, red colored light is set on roof and the restaurant easily can hold an capacity of 50 people..
Management : Very responsive and very polite too‚Ä¶They help customer to choose the right dish according to their taste.
Food : Well, Scoop serves a large amount of dish of different cuisine. From the South Indian dish to Italian, Mexican they serves all kinda food.They has a huge dish containing menu book which is really makes us difficult to choose what to eat. But after seeing some reviews and guidance on Zomato, we all the following item‚Ä¶..
Creamy Cheese Sauce Pasta (Non veg and Penne) : Well I am not a fan of pasta and all cheesy things, but still I become a fan of there Pasta. In one word it was just mind blowing. Full cheesy and can feel the perfection of the dish, each time you take a spoonful of pasta. The pasta melts into my mouth every time you take a bite. Very much recommended here. You can also try the pasta in Spaghetti variation also.
Spicy Chilly Garlic Noodles with Jap Chicken : In the main course, we ordered this one and it was really a Bulls eye for us. The dish was served in a bowl which looks great. Thin and well fried noodles with 4 mid sized chicken pieces are there in the dish. The noodles was mixed with sufficient amount of well chopped veggies. Chicken pieces were well cooked. The gravy in which the chicken pieces are served was rich spicy but not too hot, which is a really noticeable point. The quantity is sufficient for one persons, overall must try main course here.
Puppy Love : Scoop was and is famous for its legendary ice-cream. When I come early, I had tried Tutty Frutty. So this time want to try something different and ordered this one. Served with two scoop of Strawberry and one scoop of vanilla and cream on top. Gems are putted into the cream, which is really an eye catching. It tastes good but not as good like the Tutty Frutty that I tried last time. Overall good.

In conclusion, it is very obvious noticeable that Scoop has upgrade its quality in huge amount after its renovation. A must try destination at New Market area. Every item is affordable and they have a huge variety of food, All items they served are really made of love and you can surely feel it. Thanks to Zomato for the meal voucher they send to my friend

##

2016-08-31 21:23:20
Nitika
1898766
4.0
Thanks to the voucher given by Zomato, I got to know about this place. The interiors are mostly pink, with a friendly and caring staff and good food. We ordered a pizza, chola bhatura, veg burger and the chilli garlic noodles with jap chicken. Everything was good. The pizza was thin and simple, with juicy slices of tomatoes and jalapenos. The burger was okay, and the fries they were served with were really crispy. The chola bhatura had a few mistakes. Though the bhatura was perfectly ballooned up and was thick like how it's supposed to be, the chola lacked the necessary spices and was suspended in a lot of oil. But overall it didn't taste so bad. Coming to the chilli garlic noodles and jap chicken, the chicken had an unusual flavour and tasted good. It was cooked perfectly too. The noodles were nice and spicy , so they brought the whole dish together and they were the highlight of the day. For desserts we had this dessert called the puppy love where there were three scoops of ice cream ; vanilla, strawberry and chocolate with sauces and whipped cream. It was really good. I had always thought of Scoop as a dessert parlour and it is true that it should be treated as one. It is a reasonable place and had good food. Definitely going here again.

##

2016-08-23 10:31:04
Shahrukh Ahmed
15540184
4.5
One fine morning, I rose to an email from Zomato asking me to send my postal address for a gift. Though, it was not my birthday, I was too greedy for a gift and hence gave them the same. After a span of four days, I received a gift coupon for Scoop and that is the time, I made it on my bucket list to visit. However, the actual visit came after many months and well it was worthy.
I called up my best buddy to accompany me and also click few pics of the same to which he happily agreed being a photo bluff. We reached the eatery around seven in the evening and was greeted by a sweet lady who directed us to get seated. Just as we got chatting on what to order, a guy came with plenty of menus in hand and hence was standing in for us to order. We asked him to wait as our order choice would take some time.
Spending some time reading the menu, we ordered for a combo of BBQ Cottage Cheese Sandwich, Chicken Nuggets, French Fries and a Pepsi. The guy took our order and got it delivered in about 10 minutes. While being eagerly seated for food, I observed that the music was rather loud. However, the staff‚Äôs courtesy was one to look after as they are truly gem. Upon arrival the meal was less in quantity than expected. The BBQ was kinda okay but starting from nuggets to drinks all were minimal in quantity and shooed off really fast. To fill in our stomachs we ordered for Indonesian Smoked Noodles which did not taste any good in my mouth. Dejected at it, I ordered for three kinds of ice creams which they took a little while to prepare but it is worth it.
The Creme Brulee with Choco Chips gave nice flavour to one‚Äôs mouth so as the Mango Paluda with Ice Cream. However, the real amazement lies with the Pehla Nasha which contains two scoops of ice creams and a branch of Black Forest Cake. It also have had a firework attached to it which can be lit if anyone wished to. Forgetting our meal, we drooled upon the desert which tasted really good. Thus, we happily concluded our meal and to the itching question as to why the desert section was placed on the first page of the menu.

Qs) Should you visit it?
Ans) Of course you can pay them a visit and be sure to try the desserts.

Qs) Why have I rated them 4.5 stars?
Ans) Normally, in situations like this I offer to rate 4 stars, but, solely the staffs hospitality and warmness made to add up half a star.

##

2016-07-30 18:09:50
Vishal Kumar
15078751
4.5
Scoop Eat n Run is undoubtedly my favorite place and I go there very frequently. It's more like my kind of place.

Ambient : Nothing fancy about the place it's very simple and crafted beautifully keeping youths in mind. Pink color plays the major role here and even staffs dress color is pink may be it's owner's favorite color. :p Nonetheless you will like this place cos it's nice. Plenty of place to sit however I am yet to try out the seating arrangements upstairs which I believe was operational earlier but not anymore.

Staffs : The great thing about this place is the friendly staffs who always welcomes you with a smile and since I am very frequent I know some of them quite well now. Sanju, Sangita and Suman this 3 in particular are the most friendliest guys over here and they make you like this place even more with their commendable service.

Menu with a twist : Menu is huge and you get plenty of items from sandwich to biryani all available here. And one biggest plus point of this place is the experiment they do with new dishes which are more like seasonal special menu which changes every 3 months and I love that alot.

Pricing : Well pricing is decent and nothing to complain about. On a average for me everytime I go with my girlfriend the bill is around 400-700 which according to me is very reasonable as you get to eat alot too.

My favorite : Pop Chicken is a must try and you simply cannot miss that. Then Penne Arabiata Pasta with red sauce and chicken. French fries here great too but now my girlfriend won't let me eat that :( and like that there's plenty of good dishes which you gotta try yourself.

I highly recommend this place to everyone and their Special seasonal menu is a must try. Currently it's mango season so do try out their Mango Glory, Mango Firni, Aam Candy and Eggs-quse-me if you get.

##

2016-07-01 21:31:57
Sinchan Mukhopadhyay
33648168
1.0
Had gone to New Market for some work. Was lunch time, so saw this restaurant. Dropped by to check it out. As the pictures suggest, very attractive interiors! Was given a seat immediately! Everything was going alright as of now. Water was served in stainless steel glass, which I liked. 

Had ordered ‚Ä¢ Tango ( special dish ) consisting of tandoor chicken and dhaniya rice ! 

                      ‚Ä¢ Veg rice with chilly fish !

Asked for Lassi, but was informed by Mr. Suman that it's no more available. Fine, understandable.

Now, it was over 20 minutes, none of the food items was on the table. So I asked Mr. Shounak - the young man serving us, about the food. He was on the way and from the other end another female staff was bringing my food. She kept the food on the table, since there were already cutlery on the table, I took the extra ones in my hand to give it back. The lady almost snatched it from my hands. Wow ! Suddenly I looked around to make me realise that I am not sitting in a road side dhaba, but was surprised to feel the reality with the behaviour of this female staff. 

The rice was bloody cold and the chicken had lost its softness and was cold too ! Informed Mr. Shounak about this, to my surprise even he said the same thing which I was thinking, the cold tasteless dhaniya rice was heated in microwave and served. It was on special today. To the COOK ( and not chef ) - LEAVE THE JOB IF You CANT COOK, BUT DONT SERVE COLD MICROWAVED FOOD. Bloody hell. Was surprised with the audacity. 

Now, till now my partner didn't receive her food, and my food was getting colder since I was waiting for her food to come, so that we can have lunch together. 

To the waiters - Please get your basics straight. It's important to have the meal on the table at the same time when people are eating together, and not wait for another 10 minutes for the other dish to land on the table. Job of a waiter is not to just pick up food and dump it on the table, it's all about looking after the guests who come to your restaurant to have a good meal, and pay the price for it. 

Please go to a good place and dine, you will understand the difference between your service and theirs !

##

2016-06-23 15:00:55
Dr.Adwaita Nag
221626
3.5
Iv visited Scoop many times since childhood, but yesterday was my first visit in the last couple of years... The decor is still the same, colourful and vibrant. What immediately caught my eye was the revamped menu.. The menu card was attractive as were the dishes being displayed on the wall-mounted display boards.. Moreover they had a very innovative offer going on - special discounts for each day of the week - provided u wore black&white clothes or u had an elderly/kid in your group etc... Really really impressive...  A particular lampshade also caught my eye with the handle being made of inverted cups and kettles...
 Our group consisted of quite a few vegetarians, and so we ordered a motley of dishes - the best of both worlds.. Among veg, we ordered  
Spaghetti in Tomato Basil sauce and Veg Au Gratin - both were yummmy... The Chef's Veg Special Sizzler looked delectable but wasnt suited for my non-veg 'steak-y' palate..  I ordered a Penne in Cheese Spinach Sauce, Dry Chilli Chicken and Chicken Cheese Sandwich - all were tasty.... Despite being full, we also ordered 3 milkshakes as they looked absolutely mouthwatering in their picture in the menu - Oreo Cookie, Black Forest, Kitkat.... Unfortunately, apart from the Black forest one, (which had generous amounts of blended pastry crumbs) the others were a tad too dilute..
The bill was around 2.3 k..  
Scoop is one of those old joints which still remains a favourite among us Kolkattans.. overall a good place to hang out with friends over snacks.. and a welcome break from the new age pricey hookah/sports/lounge cafes... This one is just a Cafe !!! And a great 1 !!

2016-06-12 00:17:00
Ejazz Ahmed
549488
3.5
This age old restaurant has been around for i don't know how long, I used to visit this place with my parents when I was a kid‚Äì we would mostly eat their sizzlers and ice cream sundaes. And boy their sizzlers were good, if my memory serves me right. 

Recently visited the place after what I believe is a millennium, to be welcomed at a whole new and different version of scoop from what i can remember. 
Enough of the nostalgia, let's jump to business. 
Food. I would say i was happy with it, with whatever i ordered but nit something that would draw me back to the place. Ordered the classic‚Äì chicken sizzler, which I'd say is an above average steaked sizzler, the sauce is rather subtle and nice, though i expected the sizzler to sizzle for a while I don't remember hearing it sizzle as it arrived at the table. 
Apart from that we ordered some crispy chicken pepper which were pretty good and the drinks that accompanied our food were decent.

What I'd really recommend this place for is the staff‚Äì one of the most well behaved and friendly restaurant staff I've come across in my recent visits to restaurants in general. They even offered a complimentary piece of cake which wasn't on the menu, and was currently being experimented‚Äì as in the ingredients and how it ought to be made. And to be honest, the cake was indeed really good. 
And if you're the kind of person who likes to be on the phone whilst eating sumptuous food, this place offers free Wi-Fi, so a brownie point for that! 

Overall I'd say the place hasn't retained it's 90's charm with the all new jazzy colourful decor but they certainly have a good team and decent food to keep you interested. I think I'd visit them for the ice creams again. Cheers!

##

2016-06-09 22:41:51
Oishik Sarkar
3119605
4.0
I am writing on Zomato for a long now. Being an expertise I don't know how I missed this beautiful place at New Market. Well Zomato noticed that & gave a surprise treat by providing me a voucher of One of The Legendary Desert Parlour of Kolkata, Yes its Scoop.

First of all, I want to thank Zomato from my bottom of heart for giving all the food lovers such an opportunity to share their experiences in a decent way that not just help other foodies also creats its own world & community.

This message is for all the new beginner foodies on Zomato. Zomato has the most largest database of Restaurants in the World. That is because of all the foodies like us posting photos, menus, reviews & sharing our experiences with them. 

Well all of this things not just making their database strong day by day, now it also has became a hobby in our life. Zomato respects all of this efforts silently & they doesn't hesitate to love you back for all your efforts. And here's the proof, My dinner in Scoop was provided by Zomato.

Now lets talk about the restaurant. Scoop is quite popular between college goers young stars and love birds. Why not it should be, they provide some excellent numbers of desert options while they offer a beautiful dining too.

Location : Scoop is located on the ground floor of New Empire Building at New Market. Its just between  KFC and Domino's. This building is quite famous hence the restaurant is quite easy to find.

Decorations : Like all the other reviews says this one is a pink world. But I would like to call it a colorful world. Scoop is very very well decorated with funky colors that just punches your eyes & not only that those colors matches with their colorful deserts on your table. Colourful walls, Colourful chair tables, Wall posters, Led display panels showing their special menu items, Led strip lights everywhere, all of this not just creates a funky theme, it also makes a Romantic ambience. Scoop's ambience is perfect if you are thinking about to take your girl out for a romantic dinner. Unfortunately no date for me this time :p.

Staffs & Management : There were waiter & waitresses in different dress codes. They were well trained, well behaved & well mannered. From the time we entered into the restaurant to guide us through the menu they helped us really well in every angle. After placing the order they took a very short time to serve us. They have also done a pro degree on garnishing foods & that was totally seen in every item they served us. After a dish or two they even asked for our feedback about the food was good or not. They pleased us very very well. Excellent Service, A big point goes for them.

Foods : Scoop covers a large number of cuisines from  Italian, Chinese, South Indian, North Indian, Deserts & of course Ice Cream. So their menu card seems like a food dictionary too. Their colourful menu card is so big that a pro foodie can fall in little confusion. After seeing a number of reviews I came to a conclusion what should we order.

Creamy Cheese Sauce Penne Pasta with a combination of Cheese, Butter & Cream : 
The flavour of cheese covered up the place as soon it came to our table. In a single glace I observed that it was made with real perfection & love. It was served really well. The first bite of this just melts into the mouth. The dish tasted extremely cheesy & creamy. Very light spices were used but it holds up the taste really long. In simple words, It was such delicious that words can't explain. Creamy Cheese Sauce Pasta was very much preferable for me & an absolute recommended over here.

Spicy Chilly Garlic Noodles with Jap Chicken :
Wow, to the way it was served in a bowl. It looked like Chinese heaven. Noodles were very thin & very well fried. There was kind of mixed flavour of smoke & tangy sauce in the noodles, that was mixed with nicely sliced vegetables. The best part was yet to come. The chicken pieces tasted like heaven. A juicy cheesy flavor was coming from inside & that just melted into the mouth. The dish was very spicy but fortunately not very hot, just absolute likeable. By the way the quantity was average & there were 4 pieces of chicken in it, that would suite 1 person perfectly. Overall the dish tasted mind blowing & another must have over here.

Puppy Love : Now coming to their legendary ice cream. I was bit confused before ordering, between Eye Candy & Puppy Love. Then I thought Eye Candy is good for groups cause it comes with 5 scoops of ice cream. So I shatteled down with Puppy Love that came with 2 scoops of Strawberry & 1 scoop of vanilla served in a glass with full of cream on top. Oh, did I mentioned that colourful Cadbury Gems & choco chips were on it. Well my expectation for this was gone really high that time. Unfortunately it tasted very very simple. The ice cream felt good & all the common taste of other things that was used to make it were visible. It was perfect for two people to have. However it didn't surprised me with its taste that much. It wasn't bad either but an improvement can be done highly on it.

Pricing : Our bill for 2 with all the above mentioned items were Rs. 635. For me Zomato paid it all, So thanks to Zomato once again. Coming to the pricing segment I think for all the beautiful ambience, excellent service & delicious foods their prices are decently balanced that satisfies your pocket well.

Conclusion : Scoop is a restaurant that has been extracted from the Rainbow. Its a lovely colorful world inside, that is perfect to feel with your loved once over some sweet dishes made by them. Its an absolute recommend place from my side, even I am planing to visit this in near future too.

##

2016-05-11 23:32:31
Sohini Sarkar
33862921
3.5
Have a weet tooth and in dire need of biting into a pretty looking, icy, creamy dish to beat the heat this summer? Look no further. Scoop is the place where you ought to be.

Location: a few minutes walk from Esplanade Metro Station. Scoop is located at the heart of New Market, or if specifically asked New Empire Building. In other and simpler words, take a left from KFC. You'd find Scoop to your right.

Food: Scoop is a wonderland for all the people out there who likes pretty places and pretty desserts. Known for both its decorative and innovative ways of plating sweet stuff, this place is a must go!

Creamy Pasta with Chicken: perfectly cooked penne smothered in delicious white sauce and seasoned delightfully right. I have never had as good as a white sauce pasta as this before. The meat was tender and soft and the cream went well with it. (5/5)

Chicken Steak: pieces of chicken breast accompanied with saut√©ed mushroom smeared in thick sauce. Frankly, there are better chicken steaks out there. The flavours did not pan out for me. The Steak was served with grilled vegetables on the side which included carrots, cauliflower, broccoli and beans, which were a bit too plain. (2.5/5)

Eye Candy: the star among the three course meal has to be Eye Candy. Five scoops of ice creams served in cones with a side of cotton candy. This dessert deserves a round of applause because of its quite unique presentation in a rather limited budget. The menu allows you to pick your favourite ice creams among an unusually large stretch of flavours. Few of the flavours that they features are: Tutty Fruity: a combination of fruits in an ice cream (3.5/5); Chocolate Chips- creamy chocolatey delight with sudden surprises of chocolate chips in bites [con: there are much better chocolate ice creams out there than this] (2.5/5); Strawberry Cheese Cake- strawberry flavoured ice cream with cheese cake [con: cheese cake flavour was missing] (3/5); Cr√®me br√ªl√©e- sweet creamy ice cream with a hint of strawberry (4/5).

Management: this pink, pretty place comes with a team of fast working, courteous staff. Service here is a fast. Cleanliness is spot on. Full marks on the decor. You running a tight budget wouldn't stop you from grabbing a bite here, because the place is very pocket friendly too.

2016-05-07 17:47:33
Dipyaman Basu (whenstomachtickles)
627356
3.5
Its been many many years, since I had visited them last, so this review of mine is definitely not going to reflect on their current state.

Perhaps, the most popular places in and around Explanade region, Scoop has been an obvious destination for youngsters since the past couple of years, whenever it meant having quality food accompanied with some chit-chat. The first time I had dropped in here was some 12 years back. I loved the ambiance. A bit hard to describe by as I haven't been there in years, but I can easily recollect the bright lightnings and the friendly staffs.

I began to be a regular here after the bar at Lighthouse had shut down. Their Thai Section was shifted to Scoop and I have no shame in admitting, that I was a die-hard fan of their Chicken in Oyster Sauce. One or two common staffs, who were also transfer ed to Scoop, I had absolutely no issues in communicating with them. It was even later, that the Thai Section again got shifted to a brand new restaurant just beside Scoop, which was perhaps known as the 'The Oriental Plaza'.

Apart from the Thai Offerings, I loved their drinks. Good shakes (As I can recollect) was one of my obvious choice to quench the thirst. Their food however was mostly inconsistent. I remember of having visited them sometime int he year 2009 or 2010, and me and my friend were served with two horrible tasting sizzlers. We had to desert out food in the midway, and instead go to Aminia to complete our meal.

Not that I am complaining, perhaps things have changed for good in the past couple of years. May be it hasn't. But Scoop will always remain special to me, for the ¬†sheer memories I have had at this place, with my friends. Hope to find the familar face of the captain from Lighthouse Bar once again. :-)

##

2016-04-25 10:56:51
Debashish Dey - Petukbangali.com
424506
4.5
Well nowadays you have everything in your city right !! The European delicacies, the Mexican , Spanish , more than countable mughlai and Chinese outlets . But amongst all these there lies some very few joints which have its on charm and no matter wherever you go you won't find it anywhere else .

So, you are with your loved one and hopping around new market and suddenly feel hungry "Scoop" should be one of your top destinations . I love the seating arrangements where the tables are located in various nook and corners of the restaurant as a result of which you can always enjoy a cosy time with your beloved . You will get a mix culture of people coming in since it is located at the heart of new market . 

Those arijit Singh and ankit tiwari songs will transform you to a hopelessly romantic type of a mood if you are into that sort of stuff . You won't get into fine dining almost everyday in your curriculum. 

Location :- Very easy to find . Ground floor of New empire of cinema hall.

Food :- Now the most important part , scoop offers a variety of choices starting from sizzlers, fish fry , burgers , sandwiches , milkshakes , coolers ,ice teas and also Chinese and mughlai . You name it and they will serve it .  We although decided to have the following : -

--------------------------------------------------------------
        STARTERS
-------------------------------------------------------------
1. Fish Fingers ( 5 / 5 ) :- Although this is pocket pinch restaurant I wondered how can a plate of fish finger cost 194 rupees but I was too hungry and craving for some fingers so I ordered it and it simply won my heart . I have attached the pic so you can clearly see how they are served . Served in a basket which is on a top of wooden plate . And they had added some mayonese and potato chips as add ons . I promise you those were some delightfully tasty fish fingers . There were 8 pieces which we munched upon delightfully .
 
2. Eggs Nest ( 3.5 / 5 ) :- This was more of an experimental try . These are basically poached eggs served as sunny side up upon some deep fried potatoes . The fried potatoes " jhuri alu bhaja " looks like a birds nest and the egg yolk upon in looks absolutely yummy . The only problem with this dish was it was less salty . If you put a little salt on it , trust me these are 2 little pieces of delicious egg bombs .

--------------------------------------------------------------
  MAIN COURSE
-------------------------------------------------------------

1. Chicken cheese burger (4 / 5 ) :- With true honesty this was a nice burger . Not over exaggerated the party was yummy and had adequate cheese to make it a super cheesy experience with every bite . To me the burger was a winner .

-------------------------------------------------------------
 DESERTS & COOLERS
-------------------------------------------------------------
 
1. Vanilla milk shake ( 5 / 5 ) :- You can't say you ever had a bad vanilla milk shake because it is one hell of a combo . Served in a quite big proportion it was enough for 2 of us to quench our thirst especially when we were having the burger . 

2. Miss sparkle bunny vanilla ice cream ( 10 / 5 ) :- Yes that's how I will rate this dish . Firstly , the presentation was beautiful . The ice cream was served in a wine glass with plastic flowers beneath it . It was once again on top of a wooden plate . And accompanying it was a toy bunny which on shaking it glowed . It was so childish that we laughed the hell out of it . The ice cream was yummy , vanilla was mixed with coconut and served with bourbon biscuits . I will never forget this dish . It's a bummer that they took away the bunny in the end as it was only for show . But by then, it had already won our hearts .

Service : - The staff is really very attentive and they will help you with everything you need .

 Sometimes you have to adjust urself with the places you are visiting , once again I am stressing this that you won't find a fine dining experience everywhere . But in scoop you will get your wishes fulfilled . Do try their snacks as they are not popular for their main dishes . We had a wonderful time today and whenever I am in new market , scoop will always be in my mind .

2016-04-05 21:57:58
Rishabh Singh
33766326
3.5
Scoop had become my grandmother's and mine personal favourite for around 6 months I guess. The place is really  pretty and is always full! We used to come here quite often and I must say, they serve some really good food. I have had lots of dishes here. 
Flaming Chilly Prawns were my favourite. Mind you, the batter on the prawns is a bit soggy but I somehow like soggy batters! So Yay!
The Chicken Fried Rice which has egg as well is very very tasty. It's got minimal ingredients but it still tastes great! The Sweet corn soup is disappointing as the balance is missing more often than not. On the other hand the cream of spinach soup is really tasty! 
I had once ordered grilled fish as well, and may I say... Wow! The fish was really amazing! Their south indian food is quite popular but I am not very keen about south indian food, so never tried it. The desserts are also really nice. They aren't nearly the best in the city but they are always pleasing. 
Now the reason this "was" my favourite restaurant is because recently the quality seemed to have dropped and as a result the price that earlier seemed fine to pay suddenly started to pinch. I am saying this on the back of multiple "average" visits of late and not just one day. Besides, any place can have a bad day! Buy here, I am positive there's a quality drop. 
I know the capability of this place very well and I hope to see it improve and reestablish its earlier set high standards! Good Luck! And yes, you must give this restaurant atleast one shot! Happy Dining!!

The food wasn't up to the standard; the Chicken Sizzler was nice but the Jap Chicken was very oily. Hopefully in the near future if I ever visit Scoop, I hope I don't face such problems.

2016-02-09 23:58:32
Srimoi Bhattacharyya
125581
3.5
This place keeps coming up with new menus for different occasions which kind of want to make you go back just to find out what's new. They have pretty cool offers going on also ask of which can be exploited to the customers benefit.
Speaking of the food, whatever I've ordered from the vast menu these guys offer, it has been pretty decent. Although, it would've been preferable if the costing was a bit pocket friendly. 
Please do not order the biriyani or the French fries if you do not want an oil overload. Also the French fries do not come with the promised mayo dip always. I ordered the ramen on my last visit and to my woes, not only did it taste like wai wai, it was too salty for the palette. Sandwiches are good. 
The decor is a bit too loud for my taste but it screams youthfulness. Also the staff is pretty friendly, although it would be nicer if they could pay more attention on the tables to see if their guests need anything further or if it's time for billing.
Overall a decent place to hang out with your friends and yes I will be going back to check out what's new.

2016-01-27 00:21:46
The Greedy Glutton
4056571
5.0
Went to this amazing restaurant today at a friend's suggestion. It's a multi cuisine restaurant and has huge variety of foods to offer. Be it Chinese, north Indian, south Indian or continental snacks.
The menu has so much to offer that it took us a while to decide what to have exactly. Finally we zeroed on chicken ala king and mixed platter sizzler. Since both of them were continental dishes we first tried out chicken ala king. Oh my, the creamy cheese and shredded chicken combined with the parsley rice just melts in your mouth. Thoroughly enjoyed having it. The mixed platter sizzler had chicken, fish,prawn, lots of veggies and rice. Very well cooked and full marks for a unique garnishing.
The staff was really very cordial and the ambience was equally good.
Will visit yet again to try out their other cuisines.
Keep up the good work Scoop!!

##

2016-01-26 11:06:33
Shayak Das
11928401
4.5
This outlet of Scoop is situated at ground floor of new empire building in New Market near Esplanade Metro station...
After shopping at Big Bazar ,when our tummies were starving for foods we decided to go to Scoop... Watching the rating 3.2 of Scoop in zomato I didn't have so much expectations from the place...
but after having the lunch ...let me tell you that I don't believe the rating should be so low it should be minimum 4 ...
The Decoration and the Ambience is very much attractive and beautifully organised ... Food was also good ...
They have lots of items from multi cuisine... but the best part about them is the desserts specially the icecreams...
We had
German Potato Salad
Spanish Omlette with Potatoes
Quick Gun Murg Gun Pizza
Sizzler
Pehla Nasha with sparkle
Confused Identity
Hot Dark Chocolate
Now the names of every dishes there were very funny and attractive...
German potato salad was salads and potatoes mixed in mayonnaise and the plate was placed on ice cubes ... it was scrumptious...
Spanish omelette was mix of one thick omelette, two sandwiches, mushrooms and veggies... tastes good...
Pizza was very crunchy and tasty...and sizzler was also spicy and good in taste...
Confused Identity was a cooler of lichi and apple juice with pepsi on top... and was lip smacking...
Hot Dark Chocolate was served as hot liquid chocolate and cream and Marsmellows on top...
Pehla nasha was a dessert with two scoops of icecreams and one pastry cake...but how they served it, was amazing... it's written there Pehla nasha will come with a sparkle and it actually did...they lit up a sparkle cracker beside the dish... And it looked attractive... and  literally drew everyone's attention over the sparkle...
The service was also good... Even now there are some offers running...
Just for liking 2 pages in facebook (Scoop and Spice) we had 10% discount on our bill...
Overall it was a good experience having lunch over there...
#A Must Try for their winter special desserts...

Ambiance. Pretty good usually. On weekends its pretty crowded ¬†so it might be difficult to get a seat. But there's lot of space to wait around!

Verdict: I would recommend this place for different types of dosas, starters, and awesome desserts n sizzlers.

##

2015-11-16 22:50:06
Arka Mukherjee
31486541
4.0
I have been here twice and on both occasions I was quite satisfied with the food served. It is located near New Market and even though I have tried only a handful of other restaurants in the area, I think its safe to say that there is no other restaurant nearby that serves as many items, available on the menu, as over here. It has everything from north Indian to Chinese, south Indian to Italian, continental and of course the most important DESSERTS. The last one is their speciality but I will come to it later. The ambience is really good and the restaurant is quite spacious and the staffs who take orders and serve foods, are probably among the best in Kolkata, they are all really young and quite smart and really quick in taking orders and serving up the food, the place is usually full at lunch hours but even at peak hours their service is top notch, but that's not the best thing about scoop, it's their desserts that really makes this place stand out. The last time I visited the place I had fried chicken(which was really delicious and crisp), special mix noodles(which was also pretty good) but the best thing was the sundae that I had ordered, the moonrocker, this thing was out of this world, they offer a wide variety of sundaes and even other regular ice creams, if one is visiting the new market and wants to grab a quick brunch or wants to have some of the best ice creams served any where in Kolkata, then this is the place.

2015-11-05 23:44:56
Yajnaseni Banerjee
2427828
3.5
One of my fondest memories of ice cream is associated with scoop! Way back then, the decor was a little more sombre with mellow lights. And the tutti frutti was the best. But they have kept pace with changing times and taste and how! 
The decor is vibrant and happy hues dominate with mirrored walls.
Honestly, ice cream is not a novelty. Yet what sets scoop apart is the generous add ons and the presentation. If you are a chocolate fanatic definitely try pehla nasha and puppy love- a thoroughly chocolate bonanza. If you are looking for other flavours, tutti fruity or banana splitz will please you!
Apart from ice creams they serve pretty good french fries and thin crust pizzas!

Have to wait for more than 15 mins to get someone to take my order.
Ppl were so busy that they didn't had time for order even when I am asking them to come and take the order.
I ordered cheese masala dosa and chicken club sandwich combo.
In dosa though cheese was visible however there was no taste in the food. Didn't feel like eating and left the food.
Waited for half an hour more after dosa for the sandwich to arrive that too after asking so many times.
Asst manager came n ask if we need anything , when I told him that m waiting for sandwich for such a long time and if the dish is not ready we can cancel it, then he went looking for my dish. French fries was cold and not crisp at all, sandwich was not cut from the middle like we get in other places I.e coffee world.
The plate was so dirty in which the sandwich was served that didn't feel like eating and got it packed which I later handed over to the beggar outside.
We have to ask for tissue paper and wait for 10 mins to get that. While paying the bill when I asked for the container in which I ask the sandwich to be packed people had no clue what I ask for.
ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING PLACE.
If you have money to waste, not expecting good food and have lots of time, then visit this place.
Posting the pic of dirty plate.

1st review.
Went there for the first time, the decor was good. Service and food was not good. It has free WiFi but it never connects. Order a burger the bread was not at all fresh. The person on the counter does not know how use swipe a card, after a few attempts he called someone and ask how to swipe it.
