The place which describes itself as a dine-n-run place is actually that. Right in the heart of Esplanade area, this place is a good option to grab a bite in between all your shopping or even before/after catching a movie. The food, that we had ordered, Jeera rice and Murg Bharta, was sufficient for two people and tasty too. It's a pity that we could not try out any of the tandoor items as they were unavailable during Durga Pujo. I would love to go back to try more of that and maybe even the Continental fare.

P.S.  We got a 10% discount on the bill amount because we had liked the Facebook page of the restaurant. Cool deal really.

##

2015-10-14 14:48:31
Purbali Mukherjee
30555170
4.0
Location: At the Heart of Esplanade, right opposite Sreeram Arcade and between KFC and Domino's pizza.
Ambience: Owing to its location, Scoop is always full!! The lights and the cute frames on the walls add a vibrant charm to the place.
Food: I have had a lot of dishes from their menu, and I havent had anything which wasn't tasty! Their pasta (both white and red saucs) , noodles (chicken and mixed) and biriyani are tasty. But best are the main course chicken dishes and their desserts.

Con: Their only deficiency is their staff. Most of the staff have a 'don't care' attitude and you need to call for 5/6 waiters before one of them comes to attend you. This aspect of the place is very annoying. And I guess the staff need to learn to be polite and promt!

Besides this, a Foodie will surely love Scoop!

##

2015-10-05 17:56:53
Satarupa Hajra
32057172
3.5
Scoop is a great place to hang out with friends or family. It is a young, hip, zippy and colourful one. The place is located right underneath the New Empire at Esplanade. The menu is variegated. Well ot indeed proffers different South Indian, North Indian, Bengali and Chinese cuisines that we all by and large do come across at several other restaurants. But the TRP of this place lies in its range of desserts and juices. The range is good and they are experimental. Also the facts that the price is cheaper and located around the New Market shopping area, it can be touted a more favourable destination for mostly shoppers. The people intending to have only quick snacks can also head for this place.
P.S The toilet above that is usable for restaurant-goers is not at all good. It's unclean and not even scarcely maintained. Another problem one may encounter is that the restaurant gets really populated by evening so one may have to get one's feet in a queue.

##

2015-10-04 18:48:23
Oyndrila Majumder
2465282
3.0
A friend insisted that we try out this place to grab a quick lunch. I really loved the ambiance and the decor of the place. It was full of colors and packed with excited faces and quirky furniture. The french fries with the mayonnaise was crispy and the quantity was much more than I had expected. We also had pop chicken which was crunchy outside, and soft and juicy inside. The chicken as well as the batter was extremely flavorful and the hot sauce complemented it perfectly. I would definitely recommend this even though I felt that compared to the price, the quantity was less. The woktossed veg hakka noodles with the fresh veges, also tasted pretty good. There were lots of staff present but even then we had to call them about three or four times before they attended to us and this happened a couple of times. Their behavior was also pretty cold. They made us wait for a very long time even though people who arrived after us were served promptly. All in all I would love to go there again for the ice cream but I hope the staff are more courteous.

b) The waiter to come and give my order.

The pricing is moderate and the food taste is average as well. 
My suggestion is that you can give this place a miss unless you have a goal of visiting all the places in Kolkata.

##

2015-06-12 10:38:47
Sharmita Bhattacharya
726062
3.5
Scoop,located next to New Empire Cinema is a sheer blessing if you have been shopping in New Market and adjoining areas for day long and if you are dead tired and hungry! The vibrant colours and lights  used to beautify the interiors is very refreshing and make the ambience very nice. Choice of food items being plenty, you can choose from Chinese, Continental, Indian Tandoor or South Indian dishes. Yesterday it was a rainy day,and after my day-long shopping escapade with my family, i chose Scoop to chill and satiate our hungry souls. We ordered Masala Dosas, Plain Dosas, Veg Chilly Garlic Noodles and Non Veg Chilly Garlic Noodles. They also serve Chicken Dosas by the way, which I tried long bck..and liked it too. The filling of chicken keema inside the dosa is actually.too much.to finish. Yesterday's food was decent, but the Aloo filling in Masala Dosas was rather less. The Noodles, both Veg and Non Veg were great, however. Spicy, and full.of chicken, my Non Veg Chilly Garlic Noodles were awesome, and I had no reason to complain for what I ordered. The behavior of staff was nice too as they refilled our glasses of water almost instaneously. After paying the bill, also got a discpunt card for my next.visit. :)

2015-06-11 23:53:22
PROMITA GHOSH
16192666
3.5
This is one of those colourful and pretty places you don't come across often. Located at the Lindsay street in the New Market, this big joint is a treat for the eyes. The beautiful display of colours in their lights and ceilings and pretty chair and tables make Scoop a delightful place. I love scoop and i don't actually remember how many times I paid visit to this eatery. They have a multitude of dishes ranging from Italian to chinese bites as well as desserts which make you go ga ga. I love the pastas from here as well as the chinese dishes. I have never tried south indian from here so cannot recommend. This is a total value for money joint. But if you come here do try the pastas and desserts! They'll make your day. Btw do not forget to click pictures when you come (you'll know why once you visit Scoop). :)

##

2015-06-09 13:00:50
Saunak Basu
262797
3.0
Scoop is primarily known for the Ice Cream of highest order it has been serving for decades now..Today amidst so many bakeries,desert joints this place may have lost its vigour partly but I remember from my childhood days this place was one of the Leading Ice Cream Players in the city..even today I prefer the classical flavours of ice creams served here..If I am not wrong till a point of time they used to serve primarily veg delicacies but nowadays they do serve some pretty tasty non-veg dishes as well.I would recommend to go for their starters and continental dishes.. Coming to the ambiance it is quite spacious and colourful giving it a modern,funky look..The seating arrangements are more like any Global food chains, so nothing classy about it..the service is prompt and servers are well informed it seems.. Coming to the food I never actually had a full course meal here,most of the time it is about some quick nibbles with Milk Shakes or Ice Creams before catching up for a movie at New Empire..I personally adore the Milk Shakes served here,quite refreshing..also I loved the momos the cook,actually quite tasty and filling..I would recommend the BBQ sandwich, the Chicken Pizza,Chicken Sizzler..They also serve some decent enough South Indian dishes..Personally I feel their Chinese spread is decent while their Indian spread is indifferent..Go for the Ice Cream specially,that holds the charm of this place..Do try their special Sundae.
Food: 3/5
Pricing: 3/5
Service: 3.5/5
Ambiance: 3/5

##

2015-05-21 09:26:45
Poumita Das
2810584
4.0
One of my closest friend got placed recently and hence it was treat time. It was a sultry n blisteringly hot Sunday noon. We entered at about 1 O' clock. Four hungry lions.?
We decided to skip starters as there is not much option to choose from. Now this is one area where scoop needs to improve.

Coming to the main course my foodie friend Shubharthi opted for fried fish which came with with boiled veggies, chips and a lip smacking dip. I don't know its name neither do I know what was it made of. All I know is that it tasted amazing. Recommended?Hell yes..
I went for a simple chicken steak. Thankfully the chicken was well cooked and so was the veggies. And it came with bread rolls as i do not prefer rice. Only drawback was that they had sprinkled too much of pepper in the steak. It tasted more like a stew than a steak. Not recommended.
Other two could not decide what to choose so I thought baked pasta would be a good idea but the waitor informed it would take 45mins. We immediately discarded the idea n asked for pizza. Sadly it was not available. So we went for the signature dish chicken ala king and a chicken sizzler. Chicken sizzler contained chicken mutton fish and a poached egg and rice.Quite simple and well prepared. Chicken ala king was a bit disappointing. It contained pitiful amounts of boneless chicken almost lost in the sea of cheese. No complaint about the taste though. However we were not quite satisfied so we ordered a basil noodles with prawn. It was the best main course. The noodles tasted out of the world and me being a die hard Chinese lover could not keep my hands off the plate. The prawns were a little bit undercooked but the amazing taste and flavour made up for it.

For desserts we had Tiramisu and chocolate brownie with vanilla ice cream. I had never had Tiramisu before and just loved it. Recommended.
The brownie was disappointing to say the least. It was too dry and had a bitterish taste. Do not go for it even if u see other people trying it.
Overall ambiance is nice and this place is cheap as dirt. Service is a bit slow.

A 3.5 it would have been but the plus .5 for the colorful decor. Its one of those places we Bengali's refer to as "Mon valo Kore dewa jayga".

Not one of those places for having fine dining or going back twice. But a very pocket friendly place for hanging out with friends. Thumbs up Scoop :-)
With

##

2015-05-07 08:47:20
Shalini Sengupta
1077067
3.5
Been to this place quite a number of times. I don't remember being dissapointed after having the food. Range of options are really good and it is one of the restaurants where they know how to maintain a multi cuisine affair. Portions served are pretty satisfactory and filling.
I have had chicken alfredo pasta, cream of chicken soup, chicken manchow soup, few starters and even masala dosa. All were nicely prepared and good to taste. Even the waitors and waitresses are well behaved and helpful.
The only thing I dislike about this place is the too very colourful interior. The moment you enter Scoop, it's like you are visiting some Disney land or something. Must say all that colour becomes irritating and confusing at times. :/ And yes another thing is they donot have a washroom of their own and if you ask they will redirect you to the washroom of New Empire movie hall which is needless to say P A T H E T I C !
For the food and pocket friendliness of it, it is a place worth visiting.

1.5

One more thing they need to work on is - order timing, we waited for more than half hour just for our starter to reach us and also the music was just too loud Couldn't hear even what the person sitting opposite to me is saying.

My first time experience in Scoop was definitely not as I had expected!

2015-03-20 12:43:38
Vikramjit Dutta
965332
4.0
your quick grab a bite joint in the new market area, which gives you that extra bit of service and quality at no extra cost!

My first visit to this place on midweek off day. I had a few things to buy from new market, and this proved to be the ideal no frills, pocket friendly choice of eatery in area. ¬†

The decor is too pink for my personal liking & looks like a barbie doll house.¬†
The food is reasonably priced and freshly served.

My friend opted for the spaghetti in white sauce/garlic bread/coke from the penny saver options. This, they got completely wrong and came with very little white sauce & a lot of green chillis/ red chilli flakes. Was taken back & the correct dish was dished out after another ten minute wait.¬†

I ate the chicken steak in pepper sauce which came with veggies and 2 bread rolls on the side.¬†

The hostess at the gate was friendly and promptly seated us as per choice. Unexpected in an eatery in this price bracket. The order taker was courteous ¬†as well, and informed us of the wait period of our order.

The place seems to be catering to budget tourists & young couples out on a budget date. Did I mention the couple at the next table ordered biryanis & the portions were enormous - ' beraal o dingiye jete paarbena ', as most bengalis would put it!

They also have screens above most tables, advertising slides of their current promos.

2015-03-18 10:10:24
Tanwyee Ray
402819
4.5
Well again a sudden plan of shopping with my college friend to new market. A weekday afternoon and it was too hot and humid outside. But yes.. Hats off to our indomitable energy. But then, we were too hungry and tired after shopping. We decided to drop in this joint when we noticed it from a distance. We occupied a table for two. A large air conditiined space occupied by various types of comfortable designer seating arrangements. Some portraits are hanging from the wall. The pillars having colorful leaf and flower motif was an added attraction. Ambiance average. We ordered double fried lamb wrap, chicken ala king, pepsi. Chicken ala king was awesome and i didn't expect it would be this good here. The wrap was amazing and very spicy and hot. The outer cover was nothing but a roti and served with extra hot tomato sauce dip. And we had to order a dessert to cool ourselves down since pepsi was not enough. We noticed this pehla nasha on the menu. I just loved it. Black forest pastry was served with two scoops of vanilla ice cream with lots of chocolate sauce. It soothed our mouth and relieved us from the hotness. Service was good and price is very pocket friendly.

2015-03-11 11:08:41
Shamoita Bose
334351
3.0
I have visited Scoop several time and my experience over the years have eld me to believe that Scoop is a very inconsistent place to eat at. The decor is very vibrant and bright with colourful chairs. The ceilings are brightly done and the whole place is a mix of multi-chromatic decorations. They have a huge menu and they usually have moat of it available. They have an Indian section, Chinese, Continental, a range of Ice creams and Sundaes and Desserts. They also have combo meals. 
The food presentation is also very tasteful, however the food is not that good. Sometimes they live up to the expectation and plate up delicious food, the next time you order the quality is not the same. The quantity is also inconsistent and most of the times it is less than it should be. Luckily at times I have received good food whether Chinese or Continental, however most of the times I have been disappointed. Their Sundaes are nice and the Ice creams are nicely flavoured and well presented. I have tries their Creamy white sauce pasta which is moderately good. Crispy fried Pepper Mushrooms are sometimes nice and crisp at the other times soft and tasteless. There has also been an incident where my pasta had a baby cockroach in it. When I pointed it out to them they took it away and didn't charge for the dish. They had a Philadelphia Cheesecake on offer which wasn't really a cheesecake. 
Service is a little clumsy and late. Overall I have had mixed experience with Scoop.

2015-02-03 12:34:52
Rhitabrita Mukherjee
10796051
4.0
Visited the place again. .this time for more than only the Sundaes.
Located in the new market area in a place where most of the food joints are. Its a bright place with the fluorescent colours reigning , find it quite cheerful. This time we went in after a shopping trip . .very hungry. We ordered Jap chicken , a fish+French fries+ Pepsi combo and a sundae -- Pehla Nasha.
The Jap chicken was good . .a little different in taste (in a good way) but was too little in amount or rather size, but loved the sauce.
We had to wait a long time for the fish and chips but if I may say so,it was well worth the wait. In fact it was so good, the thinly crusted but crunchy fish fillets and fries , that we ordered another.
The sundae was as usual a good one with a black forest pastry and scoops of blind love ice cream but the scoops too have shrunk in size. Disappointing !
All in all the food is good but really think that they should improve the service ,try not to make the customers have to remind them again and again of the order. Also the food is a bit overpriced for the amount and the quality.

2014-12-09 20:28:33
Sayantan Bose
1025821
4.0
A nice joint with a quick service....at a great location, the heart of the city. I went with my wife and a friend and we ordered chicken club sandwich, french fries and a regular very cheesy chicken pizza from ¬†the menu...was served in about 6-7 minutes...and almost perfectly made...i wished a little more color and crispness of the breads but taste wise, there is not a bit of disappointment...layered with cheese and fried eggs...mashed chicken and juicy tomatoes and cucumbers...and the portion size was huge...it was a combo snack with french fries and they actually serve french fries comparable with McDonalds...long sleek and crisp cuts of carbohydrates....the only improvement area was the salad that the gave along with it...probably they would call it a coleslaw but i would say its a coleslaw which is 2 days old left outside the freezer...better not to serve that...the cheesy pizza was served over a wooden pizza peel...was nicely baked with right amount of cheese...
overall, i liked the place and would definitely go again if i visit the area and would recommend others...they have a good variety of indian, chinese, south indian and continental menu...the service is prompt....nice music, vibrant colors in the decor and definitely not a dull place...

2014-11-25 18:23:05
FoodieBee
848681
3.0
Have visited this place quite a lot,because less of family restaurant in New Market area.

Very colorful restaurant - colorful chairs,lights and decor.They serve almost everything, be it south Indian,north Indian,Mughlai,Chinese,Continental and Cold beverages.

But let me tell you,choose the dishes very carefully because most of them taste lack of authenticity.

In my several visits, I have tasted many items.Sometimes¬† Kashmiri Polao,Shahi Korma,sometimes Special Mix Noodles¬† with Chicken side dishes,Sometimes Chicken Sizzler/Chef's Special Veg Sizzler,but most of the times Sundae(Specially Tutti Fruity).

None of them was extra-ordinary in taste,just a typical form of the authentic dishes.

Every items are good in quantity(not in quality).Tutty Fruity is exceptional.

But even after so many negatives, the main plus point is location and item options.

Thus Scoop remain a popular destination in Esplanade area

2014-11-18 15:58:42
Darpa Narayan S
1617754
4.0
The moment you enter this joint the first thing that strikes your eye is the vibrant sympohony of colors all around. It seems like you have come inside a rainbow surrounded by clouds. The decor of this place is striking and just a eye candy that gives you a soothing sensation. This place is located near the new empire cinema of new market. This was a place which created a food court type environment even before the shopping mall culture came to town. They offer almost everything ranging from salads, pasta, pizzas, chinese dishes, kabab platers, even simple maggi noodles, ice creams, juices, shakes etc. You name it and this scarlet red place has got everything to make your mood. One of the most important point supporting this joint is their reasonable price which could be adjustable to everyone's budget. Hence if you are near by new market area and looking for something rather than typical street foods in a reasonable budget then "scoop" is your destination.

4.0
After a hectic exam me and my pals were dead hungry and decided to give the utmost pleasure to  our stomach at scoop. The interior is large and nicely decorated. We were a pack of 6 people and luckily got one of the tables to sit . After a huge discussion we ordered an  indo ‚Äìchinese mixed menu in the starter section :P It was Fried wantons, chilly garlic basil prawn, Tandoori fish and Tandoori murg followed by diet pepsi . The starters were yummilicious specially the prawns with a zesty touch and the other ones were flavorful too. The Tandoori fish was succulent and immensely spicy. We  literally wanted to lick our fingers but unfortunately we couldn‚Äôt do so. The main course came after a short while & it had Grilled fish, Cantonese noodles (non veg) Flaming chilly prawns, Indonesian shrimp fried rice and spicy chilly chicken. The Cantonese noodles is too healthy with steamed veggies making it very appetizing and even the grilled fish was delectable. I personally found the prawn dishes are above praise worthy, the tastiest prawns I ever had. The fried rice and chilli chicken was also good ,nothing extraordinary but  I found the quantity was little less. The staffs are well behaved and the service too was up to the mark. It is obviously recommendable for  atleast once but  for prawn lovers - twice, thrice or more.

2014-10-01 14:31:50

1.0
Visited this one on the very first day of Durga Puja, and my experience was just horrible, and I literally mean it. First when we entered the restaurant i really liked the ambiance, it was full of vibrant colours and soothing music, we got a table for three of us. Then the main part starts, first we were sitting just unattended for half an hour, even nobody came with a glass of water. Then after calling thrice one lady came to take the order. After placing the order we were chatting and suddenly the lady who took the order came with some plates and spoon and and literally dumped on our table, we were really shocked with this kind of attitude, though all of us were in festive mood we ignored this. Then one guy came with the order and just left the bowls and left, there was no one to at least arrange the plates, whatever we were hungry at that time so helped each other. The food was ok , but I found the quantity a little less according to the price (You can get sufficient amount for 2 people in any restaurant in China Town at lower price). But there were more surprises waiting for us, we asked for water and the same lady who took our order came and she accidentally overfilled "TWO" glasses ( I don't know how it could be possible ), and didn't even apologized for that. Then we noticed something was floating in one of the glasses, we asked the lady to change the glass and she surprisingly asked us what is the thing floating, we took a close look and found some small onion like thing, then she asked how that thing gone in the glass and by her tone it was clearly reflecting that she was trying to mean that if we are responsible for this or not, then by gods grace she replaced the glass. We quickly finished the food and paid the bill and left the place as soon as possible. Truly speaking this place just spoiled our mood for the whole day, and I would never ever recommend any of my friends.

We had no idea what a mistake we are making by going upstairs.

We were directed to sit on a table right infront of the door. The AC was either too low or absent upstairs. Not nice. The waitress arrived to take our orders. She had that constant eyebrow lifted expression with so much attitude that it would instantly irritate you. We ordered Chole Bhature and Capsicum Utthapam. She asked if we wanted mineral water with the same rude tone. When I said she could serve serve plain water, man! you should seen the reaction when she just said 'we dont serve plain water'. Well, the restaurant rules can differ and it is alright but atleast be polite. What the hell! So the Queen waitress marched off telling us it would take a minimum of 30 minutes :/

The food arrived at around 3:40. Three friends left from a table beside us after the snooty behavior of the same queen waitress. The chole bhature was good to my relief! My sister was quite pleased with her food till she found a small stone in her food (picture follows). I was not surprised by now. My Capsicum Utthapam was nothing great. It was not bad either.¬†

The worst part was there was a room (store room) right in front. They brought in the food from downstairs and kept it inside that room before serving it to everyone for some reasons. So what is so bad about it? Well, the room had a broomstick and a corner all red with paan stains (picture follows). This room was right opposite to my chair and after one view of it, I could not gulp down my food. I mean how can you keep the food which has paan saliva? Where is the hygiene factor? Yuck!

We also had to ask for tissue papers as they were not provided otherwise. There was a sweet guy who served us food. Finally a relief from the other rude waitress. However, I would never recommend this place to anyone. There are just colorful interiors, just on the ground floor and that is all that I liked here.

So, quite a disappointment we had. And I am never going back again. Period.

##

2014-08-24 13:31:20
Shiladitya Sarkar
384424
2.0
Was in this area after ages...thanks to a bunch of friends who decided to go shopping on Saturday evening. The area was teeming with people as expected and the weather was sultry to say the least. We choose Scoop for some air-conditioning comfort. On entering we were told to wait for 5 minutes near a gate. The lady was sweet and a glance revealed the place was filled with hungry shoppers...some with family and some with their partners!

Got a table by the promised time for the five of us. We wanted to order momo and some chinese snacks (and it was evening time) but the waiter politely told us that Chinese and Indian dishes would take around half an hour to arrive and continental  or south indian was the only option because of the rush. We took his word and ordered a large "Yum Yum Yummy" pizza and "As you like it" Ice cream. The pizza arrived in 15 minutes and was not served on a regular tray but 3 side dishes with three slices each instead. The pizza was not so yummy as it sounded even after we put lots of oregano and chili flakes! The chicken toppings were small and I could not find much vegetables either. As requested, the ice cream was served right after we polished off the pizza. It did live up to scoop's reputation, served in a huge bowl with different flavors like butterscotch, vanilla and chocolate complete with nuts and fruits. It did make up for the pizza disappointment.

A note on the interiors. I noticed the false ceiling in certain parts of the restaurant in a pretty bad shape although the place looks bright with a lot of colours and plastic furniture which gives the place a young feel. The air conditioning was terrible considering the fact that it was full and the weather was extremely sultry outside. And finally, while leaving we saw puke lying on the floor which was unattended to (it seemed for sometime). Yuk!

2014-07-21 17:53:02
Abhinav Acharya
1999898
4.0
What do I say about this place... Its one place I always try to go whenever I visit kolkata. Located in esplanade, near the new market area surrounded by many fast food joints and restaurants. But this place stands apart in the crowd. Well atleast when one enters the restaurant. Has a very nice ambience,neat funky decor. And a courteous staff. I have been told that they even given discounts to all-women customers. The place is spacious and houses a modest crowd at any given time. They recommend us to book in advance. Now to the food. Well they have a good variety of cuisines which include indian, Chinese and other oriental dishes. They keep changing their menus from time to time and they also keep special menus for special occasions. I like their smoothies, and among the main course the reshmi chicken, the tandoori variety and pulaos are my favourites. I would recommend anyone living in Kolkata or anyone nearby to try out this place at least once.

##

2014-07-09 17:25:17
Ujwal Choudhary
1054168
1.5
Location: New Market

Gone are those days when one used to go on a shopping round at new market and made it a point to drop by at Scoop for a quick bite or a full-fledged meal. 
Scoop is located right beside the New Empire which was quite famous in the good old days for the screening of English movies that were released here. 
The ambiance out here is quite colourful and as you enter it would simply cheer up up. 
But, sadly this happiness is quite short lived and is taken over by a grumpy face as soon as you seat yourself. Yes, uncomfortable seats.

This place has anyway taken it's shortcut to oblivion with the help of the rude servers, near to average food across all cuisines they have on offer and last but not the least the stench that overshadows the room fresheners they spray! 

This place used to be one of my favorites in those early days but, a recent visit with the most disgusting experience rendered this place to be a strict no-no for me. 

What made the experience bad? 
-A smelly place altogether. 
-Drinking water not being served even after reminders.
-Food portions do not justify the prices. 
-Bill given along with the meal. :\ 
-Rude Staff and too busy doing nothing.
-Instead of accepting that the food wasn't upto the mark, silly excuses are given, out which the excuse that tops the list is "This dish is made like this". I mean, c'mon, we customers aren't fools. 

Good experiences turned bad! :\

One star from me.
+0.5 for all the old times this place made me come back for more.

Suddenly on 3rd July 2014, when I had ordered my fav sizzler, I was taken by shock as other than a small chicken piece and an omlet...I cud not see the previously used items. There were no french fries, no baked vegetables. When I asked the floor manager, she retorted that we had ordered some 'sizzling' which is different from a 'sizzler'. On asking the waiter, he said that the platter has changed. I requested for a proper sizzler. I was made to wait for 30 odd minutes when all the waiters had a small meeting and no one bothered to serve our desk. And then had to call a waiter for the bill for the remaining food. Such a bad experience for a regular customer ! Disgusting ! They change platter randomly, but their floor manager is not aware off ! And they expect me to believe that lie ! I rarely comment/rate in Zomato but this one was needed. Customer service sucks in Scoop ! And they give u some random dish and they tell lies about a platter-change. If the platter has changed, why is the customer not informed before the service ? Disgusting ! Wasted my one hour for naut ! I wud hv rated this place negative...had there been an option to...(Mind u..my previous rating was 5 when I had first visited this place). I have seen this place deteriorate over a year ! Time to search for a better sizzler in Kolkata ! I m done with Scoop !

2013-11-22 23:37:23

803841
3.5
Just back home fresh from my first visit at Scoop. The location is fantastic... very easy to find. What hooked my attention when I entered the place was the decor. Simple yet elegant; especially the smart way lighting has been used over here. It gives you a very 'posh' feel.

Ice creams are famous over here... so I stuck to the basics. Ordered a Moon Rocker Sundae (I LOVE butterscotch) and a Cran Cooler Pink Me Chiller. They tasted pretty satisfying, but were quite pricey too.

Final Verdict: The rest of the menu looked tempting & I'm sure you'll find it hard to resist yourself from ordering other items once you're here. So my advice for you is to carry some extra bucks. It definitely looked like one of those places which will turn out to be your favorite hangout zones.

##

2013-10-08 19:50:09
Ankur Banik
737186
3.0
Located in the same building as the more popular Kfc,Barista,Dominos the thing about this particular place that will draw your attention and make you want to give this place a try is its colourful and funky decor.At least it was so in my case.
I visited this place for the first time about 4-5 yrs ago.Back then I used to love their ice creams and sundaes.They were excellent and very decently priced too.The main course items were not as good but decent nonetheless.The menu was also quite varied.
After quite a long time,I visited this place again yesterday thanks to the heavy rain.I was surprised to see that the menu had become even more extensive.It contained alomost everything ranging from North Indian to South Indian to Chinese to Pizzas to Burgers to even Continental items.Since we were not too hungry and it was just the two of us,we ordered a Chicken ala king and  a chocolate shake.The chocolate shake was quite nice.But the chicken ala king was quite a disappointment.It took quite a long time to arrive and when it finally did arrive we were amazed at the quantity.It was pitifully small.The taste was also not the greatest.And to make matters worse,the price was quite high.In fact the prices have had a significant hike and it is higher than the menu on zomato.Unfortunately,I felt that while the prices have gone one way,the quality of the food has gone the other way.
Coming to the ambience,as I mentioned already,it has a uniquely colourful and funky decor.It is may be a bit too colourful.It is the first thing you would notice about the place.They provide seating in chairs which are colourful but not too comfortable.The place is always crowded and there is always a busy feel about the place which for me makes it quite unsuitable for fine dining or a date.Its quite okay though if you visit in a group.The staff are friendly but the service is on the slower side except the desserts and sundaes.
Overall I feel this is a place which has a lot of potential.But at present,if at all I were to make a recommendation about this place I would suggest the sundaes and desserts only.

2013-09-11 21:58:55
Tarun
1155456
2.0
Scoop is located in building that also hosts the new empire amidst that busy new market area. It used to be on the agenda when there weren't many multiplexes and new empire used to showcase the few english movies that would realease here and there weren't any kfc or a dominos nearby. Its got a colorful decor but very okayish. The seats are not so comfortable for me atleast. The staff service is not so great either.

The menu is elaborate and one could get almost anything like north indian, chinese, italian, burgers, sizzlers, ice creams................But i would stick to their ice creams and sundaes alone 2 years back but now even for the ice creams i would go for a cream and fudge counter located just in front of scoop.

The prices are not so reasonable compared to the park street restaurants. The quality of food is very ok for such prices. I find the chinese food pretty average, sizzlers below average. indian food is ok though. The burger is the fat old indianised one which is ok but nothing as compared to one served at cafe corner at similar price. Ice cream sundaes make up for the damage done but not so much to warrant another visit.

2013-05-25 18:10:34
Niladri Chakraborty
775182
3.5
I visit this place frequently with friends. Factors that attract us are:

1) Low price
2) Good Taste (We love the crunchy shakes in summer and kebabs are just awesome)
3) The colourful, but not too bright atmosphere, is a turn on. (Makes us feel younger and nostalgic)
4) Staff is good - quite attentive
5) Not so posh. So you can eat and chat with your companion (s) in your own way
6) Perfect location
7) The seating arrangements are fine

Scoop is the perfect choice for anyone who goes to Esplanade area frequently and fancies an affordable tasty meal if he or she feels ravenous about it.

I don't recommend chicken nuggets. Try the light, soft and palatable kebabs there (my personal favourite). You may try the cold nourishments available there too, especially, in summer.

We sat down and after 10 minutes one female waitress came in and took our order with all the snootiness of the Queen of Sheba. Needless to say, we were not impressed. We ordered a pasta and a fried chicken dish because we were hungry, and the girl told us repeatedly about some stuff or the other, which were more expensive. When we told her firmly we wanted this order, she was quite rude and flounced off. 

After 10 minutes, she got our food in, and my friend was dismayed to see the measly five small pieces of chicken in the plate with 2 cucumber and 1 slice of carrot. For 150/- or so, she did not expect this. On the other hand, the pasta was decently proportioned. 

The bad part came after this - halfway down our meal, the waitress actually put down the bill in front of us. This was clearly bad manners, and we could see that the restaurant still had at least 4 empty tables, and there was no reason for her to be rude. Annoyed, we paid, and marched away. Sorry but I am not coming back here.

##

2013-03-06 17:18:50
Angi C
73425
4.5
New Empire's been around a long time, but Scoop packs quite a punch. The place is very noticeable from the outside, because of it's bright, cheery exteriors and seems to magnetically attract weary shoppers from New Market. 

The ambience is bustling, and fast. With quite a load of tables, this is the quintessential quick fast food joint. The menu has something to fit everyone - whether you're looking for a Continental bite, a long-drawn Indian meal or just a sundae - this place has all of it. The sundaes are extremely good, as are the dosas. Good food at pretty good rates, perfect to refresh oneself after a long hard day. 

The service is also pretty fast, looking at the number of patrons it gets everyday. The final verdict - a great joint to rev up the appetite, if you're tired and in the area.

2013-02-25 06:14:07

I used to visit this place quite often with my friends during my school and college days. I still remember the days when New Empire and The Globe used to be the paradise for English movie buffs. The multiplex culture was not significant back then. I would be wrong if I say this place is a delight for culinary senses. This is a pretty ordinary restaurant with average food. It is an ideal place for the students to save the pocket money. The place is very noisy as well. However, unlike few other restaurants in the New Market area, it is comparatively more hygienic. You may want to try out their desserts and mocktails. You won't be disappointed. However, I would not prefer this place for a lunch or dinner if I am in Kolkata for few days. I'd be heading towards Park Street instead !! :)

2012-09-13 15:39:54
Mainak Bhowmick
314398
3.0
If you are not sure about your cravings, come to Scoop. This place offers you all the cuisines you are aware of. The best part is you won't feel robbed after venturing in the unknown food zone. Surprisingly the south Indian dishes are good here. Also the continental stuffs are also nice. But save the best for the end. The desserts will simply sweep you off your feet. The sundaes, the fruit mixes and the ice creams are just divine. The place is quite colorful and you'll mostly find it crowded. But once you are here, your tastes buds will surely thank you for coming here and allowing the ice creams to melt in your mouth.

2012-08-22 20:45:56

4.0
Firstly I want to say a few words about its Ambiance. Ambiance is nice. Decoration is very very colorful. Very very attractive.
U can find almost everything here e.g. Chinese, Continental, Indian and desserts.
South Indian food is very good, specially Dosas.
Chinese dishes is okay. But north Indian dishes are best! Chicken preparations are also very tasty. Chilli Chicken is awesome. Tandoori Chicken is nice. Desserts are also very good and yummy. Cold Coffee and Lemon Cold Coffee are nice.
Staffs are okay but the negative part is the service. Service is very slow. We have to wait almost 30mins for delivery. 
Price is reasonable and pocket friendly.
Worth a visit.

2017-11-14 19:52:14
Agnimitra Roy
2899822
2.5
It's been quite some time since I visited this place(sorry to say, the pic isn't from the last time we went there). This is a nice place to opt for when you decide to splurge for some occasion but since I didn't taste their actual food, I can't really vouch for it. Over a span of several dates and birthdays, I've dropped in this place. The ambiance isn't too quaint but serene enough to enjoy a romantic date and also chic enough to crowd in the seats and spend the time with a group of people.

I've had their Cold Cafe Frappe, As You Like It, Pehla Nasha, some other cold coffee variants and 'scoop' offerings! Nothing is above average but the place is ideal over a scoop or two to scrape every other minute while you catch up with friends.

If you're famished, you can find better places in the vicinity but if it's to spend time with someone and you're near this place, don't give a second thought.

##

2017-11-12 19:31:20
Sagnik Bose
37972640
4.0
Located in the New Market area, this place is famous for their ice creams and deserts and for the right reasons.
While my visit there with my friend I ordered the Dark Temptation. A mix of chocolate and vanilla ice cream with brownie on the top can never taste bad. And the additional wafers are always appreciated. The brownie just melts into your mouth giving a hint of dark chocolate right before you dive in for the ice creams. I really enjoyed it and would definitely order this again sometime.

My friend had a Big Boy shake and it's one of those shakes that are presented so beautifully that you almost hesitate to destroy it by putting it in your mouth. But once you do it tastes absolutely amazing. While I had only a bit from my friend for tasting, I could tell by the way he was eating it that it was an enjoyable experience. 

The staffs were good and the ambience is also okay and nothing to complain on that front. 
So overall I really enjoyed my time here and would like to go back again sometime and recommend others to visit as well.

2017-11-01 11:27:45
Soumita Raichaudhuri
38625844
3.0
Can't count the number of times I have visited this place owing to its location in New Market. Mostly crowded, the place is pretty loud for my choice. Average interiors. The butter masala dosa is good in taste and quantity. The biryani combo is a disaster though at the price. Special mixed fried rice was one dish I particularly liked  paired with chicken hot garlic. The mutton dopiaza and butter naan are nothing to go gaga over. And as for desert, I ordered a one called Love and Disaster- the love was so in disguise that all we saw was the disaster. Courteous but extremely late service from the staff.
At the prices charged, the service is surely wanting.
The only saving grace of the place is the Rosa which is value for money.

##

2017-11-01 10:26:55
SHALINI ChAudhuri
44018533
4.0
I loved this small parlor near new market area.It's really a good place with lots of combos and ice creams. I went there with my friends during pujo.Even at that time the quality served is good.We tried Chicken keema Dosa which is astounding great dosa I ever eaten.It became my instant favorite. ##

2017-11-01 08:11:54
Pranjal Dey
33598599
2.5
Everything is overpriced. The food is not that good. Some of them come free with hair too. And when they change that item with a freshly made one i don't know how that same item turns out smaller in size. My friend had ordered a chicken keema dosa which contained a strand of hair. On complaining they changed the dosa but somehow it turned out smaller in size. Not like he had consumed a big chunk of the initial order too. Moreover the keema was filled with ground bones. Maybe that comes complimentary too.
We had also ordered French fries with cheese and chicken. The same problem with the chicken. I don't know where they get their chicken keema from. But maybe the management doesn't know that bone free chicken keema is readily available in the market. In fact that is the only sort of chicken keema found unless you shove a whole chicken into a mixer grinder and grind it. The fries were half burnt and the cheese....we had to dig up the cheese buried inside the dish.
The only dish worth mentioning was the Aglio Olio. A bit oily but it is prepared with olive oil so not unhealthy entirely. The pasta was perfectly boiled and al dente. The dish was well seasoned too.
I'm sure everyone who has visited New Market has seen this place at least once therefore i did not bother writing about the location. However the staff is quite friendly here and helpful although half of the time they are missing.

##

2017-10-02 20:01:09
Angellena Sarkar
36165508
3.5
Located in the heart of New Market, this is one of the restaurants which is busy n filled all round the year. It has got a wide range of cuisine and menu to choose from which makes it a great public attraction. The interiors are decorated with pretty pinks n lights, perfect for kids. Visited on a Saturday afternoon and had to wait for 10mins before we got our table. Ordered a few dishes. The first being fish in garlic butter sauce, which was served with mashed potatoes and very cute garlic bread. The next up was the mutton thali, with mutton curry, tandoori roti and raita. The quantity of this particular dish was disappointing. Next up was the kebab platter which was reshmi kebabs and herb rice, both of which lacked salt to my taste. The last dish of the day was lamb sizzler, which was a clear winner among the rest. The meat pieces were well cooked, soft n succulent, served with a portion of herb rice. The rice and the gravy complemented each other. Then we tried their shakes, strawberry and dark forest shake to be precise. The dark forest shake had crumbs of cake  in it, both of which was served with whipped cream n cookies. Would visit again to try cuisines maybe.

2017-09-06 14:06:46
Ayantika Bhaskar

3.5
Visited this popular kitschily decked restaurant in the afternoon after a shopping spree at New Market. Interior is decorated with a riot of colors, bird cage, owl on a tree branch, paper dragonflies from ceiling, watering can sprouting flowers, pictures etc.
We had the Love & Disaster, which came in a boat-shaped glass dish on a dainty doily and adorned with a pretty paper umbrella. The dessert item consisted of three ball-shaped scoops of Blind Love ice cream, drizzled with chocolate sauce and garnished with two chocolate wafers, cashew nuts and topped with a red cherry. It tasted well, enough for two people to indulge in some sweet affair.
For lunch and exquisite-looking desserts and shakes a good choice in the area.

2017-09-04 23:22:35
Sanjana Dey
33918301
4.0
It was one of my favourite places, until today. The justification of 4* is that this place has always made me happy in the past. There was a Mango festival going on when I happened to visit Scoop the last time and the two dishes that I ordered were absolutely amazing. With the same expectation I visited today, but alas! I was let down. The place is always too crowded but today even the staff was too busy.

We ordered the following:

Tik Tok Murg: Plain chicken tikka on the mint sauce.

The Majesty: A regular chicken biryani.

Puppy Love: It was as expected and nothing extraordinary. Scoops of ice-cream with whipped cream and gems.

Divine Chocolate: It was supposed to be a best seller but unfortunately the last was just too ordinary. There was nothing divine about the chocolate cake and even the dish was not very clean.

Overall it's a good place but today it was not the Scoop I always admired.

2017-09-04 22:59:35

1.0
Terrible experince.Went there and ordered Thali Style around 8:30 pm. After about 5 minutes, I ordered Half Tandoori Murg. They served the tandoori Murg around 9 pm. It was way below standard. The chicken, the raita everything was bland.
From here on, began my mind-numbingly long and tedious wait for the main course. During the course of nearly another half an hour, I sat and starved and was border-line ignored by the waiting staff during my repeated enquiries about the remainder of my order.  At around 9:30, I was forced to call the waiter and ask for my  bill on what I have consumed as it was getting late. The waiter checked and informed me that they had not even registered my order of Thali Style, let alone convey it to the kitchen! 
This has to be a new mile-stone in poor quality of service. Thanks a lot Scoop for ruining my evening and wasting an hour of my life.

2017-08-31 19:30:44
Priyanka Ghosh
30538473
3.5
Today visited this restaurant for lunch in New market area after a tiring shopping. It was around 2.30 pm and the place was almost full. The dining area was quite big with nice decorations. Our today's food journey includes,
* Starter : Chicken Nuggets
* Main Course : Biriyani with Chilly Chicken Combo
* Drinks : Pepsi
The service was quite fast. The food arrived altogether in a few minutes. Firstly the Chicken Nuggets tasted as usual good. 8 PCs of Nuggets were served with chips. Biriyani and chilli chicken combo also tasted decent. Biriyani was just simple and chilli chicken was good. 6 PCs of chicken was served in the combo. Quantity was more than enough for feeding single person. Only one thing that I didn't like at all they served the biriyani and chilli chicken together in a bowl, so that the gravy was all mixed up with the rice. It would be better if they serve the biriyani and the chilli chicken separately. Otherwise the foods were pretty good. Prices were on higher side. They also charged 18% GST on the total amount. Our bill for two persons was 791 RS. You can give it a try once.

2017-08-31 13:29:16
Debalina Mukherjee/thathungrytraveller
2515676
4.0
This cafe cum dessert parlour is located in the busy streets of New Market area. It's crowded almost all the time due to the location. Whenever I go for shopping at Esplanade I manage to drop in here. The desserts here are to die for. I order Banana split, Moon rocker which gives 3 scoops of butterscotch and one scoop of vanilla ice cream with chocochips, chocolate sauce and nuts. The mocktails are also nice here. You can get a whole variety of cuisines from Vada pav to Chinese and Mughlai. I ordered Crispy chili babycorn and chicken cutlets. I have also had Puri and bhatora. The food is very tasty and the portions are huge. But this place is a little pricey but the food is worth it anyway. The ambience is very colorful and vibrant. It's spacious and won't take much time to get a table. The service is prompt. If you haven't yet visited this place, this recommendation is for you.

##

2017-08-19 11:17:23
Sulagna Mukherjee
31998332
3.5
Scoop is a restaurant situated in near New Market area beside Domino's. The interior decor of this restaurant is really very nice and the seating arrangements and the background music is good. The restaurant serves amazing sundaes and ice-creams and shakes along with main course foods.

Now coming to the food. We have ordered for-

1) Jap Chicken and Noodles combo ( It was good in taste. Nothing extra ordinary and the proportion of food is good for one)

2) Barbeque Chicken Sandwich ( I personally did not like this sandwich. The Barbeque sauce was so runny and the chicken pieces were a bit smelly, chewy and felt like they were stale)

3) Cr√©m√© brulee flavoured ice cream( I loved the way they presented that one scoop of ice-cream in a small tea cup and a chocolate wafer stick. The ice cream was good)

4) First Love ( It was also an ice cream scoop and tasted of caramel and chocolate with small pieces of nuts. I liked this one also)

5) Kit kat shake ( Lovely presentation. I am sorry to say but this was so bad in taste. I felt like I was having some bitter chocolate flavoured water. I doubt whether there was any milk in that milkshake and the only good thing about this is the presentation and those two little small pieces of kitkat)

Service is slow and staffs are courteous but unprofessional in behaviour. We have to ask for water several times as they don't serve water unless you ask them too. Food quality and taste nothing much worth mentioning. Ice-creams are the only good things here. Hope to visit there someday to grab a scoop of some good ice cream.

##

2017-08-18 19:34:12
Sudipto Roy
297419
4.0
The food is great. The service is very good. One needs to wait a bit but I can safely say that the food is veery FRESH. We ordered:

Sweet baby corn
Chicken Hakka noodles
Masala Pepsi
Chocolate ice cream

Have to say each item was prepared very well without being too much spicy or blunt. The Hakka noodles stands out amongst the lot. Very smooth and fresh noodles and vegetables with chicken and egg. What I liked most was soy sauce was subtly used in the noodles. Many restaurants uses too much soya sauce which kills the taste overall. The sweet and spicy corn was excellently cooked with a tangy taste. The masala Pepsi was just pespi and JAL jeera but went well overall with the food. A special mention about the ambience..someone did a good job with this. Many thanks

Quite a find. A multi cuisine restaurant with Chinese, Italian, South Indian, North India, and Burgers and finger food. One of the highlights is the multitude of variety of dosas available. The desserts were great though, especially the Mango Lassi and the three flavour ice cream sundae. Loved it.

##

2017-07-03 18:33:04
Prerana Paul
41456280
4.0
Shopping is a tiring task and there's no place to go better than Scoop when hunger strikes amidst all the bargaining at New Market! The place is as colourful as possible and you'll never find it empty (at least I never did!). They nearly serve everything! From pizza to biriyani. So whatever you want to have, they will definitely have it in their menucard. 

I'm a fan of their milkshakes and desserts. The kitkat shake looks lovely but doesn't taste as great as it looks. The burnt onion with chicken curry combo is good and the quantity is more than sufficient for a single person. I've tried their chicken bharta which tastes great but the quantity is not enough for two people. 

To sum up, this place has always been my go-to place whenever I go for shopping at new market. Drop in to quench your thirst or end your hunger with your shopping bags!!

##

2017-07-01 10:28:19
Subhashree Sarkar
35978669
4.5
This is the best place to eat out after shopping at New Market. I wonder how I had missed this one earlier despite being a regular in that area.

Location- Beside KFC, Opposite Shreeram Arcade

Interior-
Very well decorated, with colourful lights. Pleasing ambience. We were lucky enough to visit this place when the ground floor was full due to the Eid Rush at New Market, and were taken upstairs. The first floor is an even more calm place, with light-lined glass walls, so that you can see the outside clearly.

Food-
the Continental Cuisine is great here. A huge menu. We ordered:
1. Royal Treat Pizza (regular): The size was decent enough and the pizza was so soft and tender, laden with cheese. Even the sides were mellow, which you don't get at Dominos. The Pizza was served on a wooden utensil.
2. Stuffed Chicken: This was a pure delight. Stuffed with great fillings and served with mashed potatoes and vegetables, it is great to serev two as a side dish.
3.Pehla Nasha: We were just planning to try a dessert and this one's name was attracting us a lot. It is a creamy pastry with milky cream on top and two dollops of yummy ice cream on both sides. What came as a huge but pleasant SURPRISE was that the dessert was served alongside a sparkler candle which sparkled for just a few minutes( fortunately).

Facilities- Free Wifi

##

2017-06-30 22:59:19

32632235
4.5
Scoops is an all time favorite, located at the heart of New Market. We come here often to grab a quick bite or kill some time. Everything ranging from the food to the ambiance to the service, is praiseworthy. The place is quite spacious and can accommodate a lot of people on a busy day. The staff is polite and quick at what they do, haven't faced any rude or indecent behaviour till date. The menu has a lot to choose from and the food is worth every penny spent. We ordered a Chocolate Milkshake, Cold Coffee, Chilli Babycorn, Creamy Baked Fish and Grilled Chicken with Mashed Potatoes. These were good choices on our part and we enjoyed our food throughout. Standard bill for two people - 1k approximately. Looking forward to come here again very soon.

2017-06-21 13:17:56
Avirupa Basu
37871044
3.5
We sneeked off to Scoop for a quick lunch sometime back. The interiors are quite funky, with colorful decor and interesting pictures and quotes on the walls. The menu is also very innovatively designed with cool names and a mix and match of delicacies. 
We ordered chhola bhatura, uttapam, chicken ala king, naan, mutton korma and milkshakes( oreo and butterscotch). The uttapam was yummy. It was very well made, soft and tender. The chhola bhatura was great too. Two huge bhaturas with ample quantities of spicy chhole and pickle made us all very full but then the chicken ala king came and that was amazing too. It was creamy and delicious. The rice and the chicken blended very well together.
Now comes the bad news. The mutton korma was BAD! It wasn't cooked properly, the mutton was hard and the spices hadn't blended together at all. Similarly, the milkshakes tasted pretty mild. The oreo one was just biscuity and the butterscotch one too bland. The service is rather slow and they take at least an hour to bring all the food to the table. But it is pocket friendly. To sum it up, a quick snack at a reasonable price is what this place stands for.

2017-06-11 22:03:33
Joyeeta Chakraborty
31670732
3.5
Scoop is a hidden gem among the hustle bustle of New Market. Known to most college goers, this place has variety of things to offer. Starting from milkshakes to oriental to south indian to pastas pizzas sizlers and what not.
Stays packed most of the time, and because of this mad rush sometimes orders get delayed. Moving on to the food, on my first visit I had a black forest milkshake and spicy garlic noodles. My friends had kitty mat milkshake and oreo milkshake. The milkshake was too good and at the bottom of the jar, there was a piece of cake soaked in chocolate sauce!
Their beverages are really worth a try.
Next, the noodles were okay, nothing great. The chilli was a bit on the higher side which killed the taste of it. Even the quantity was an issue.
Hence, if you'relooking for a place to grab a refreshment or a quick bite whilst shopping at new Market, Scoop might do you justice.

Finally they took my contact number and picture of my SMS from Paytm and released us. This was heights of wasting a consumers time and taking the test of patience.
Never ever going back there for food! I could get better food and better service in the same area at that cost.

2017-04-20 15:19:35
Debolina Chaulay
36906618
3.0
When you are hell tired after having a shopping spree at New Market,you can go to Scoop,a multicuisine restaurant where you can get anything and everything from sandwich,burger,pizza ; noodles,fried rice,manchurian to polao,biryani,vada,dhosa.

We ordered chicken a la king,vegetable polao and chicken butter masala,garlic nun and kadhai paneer.We had to wait for quite a long time.And my creative friend made that time productive by decorating the plates with sauce.well you all can see that in the pictures below. :)

I was so hungry,and that chicken a la king felt like heaven in the mouth.But then,when I've almost finished half of my plate,I saw a hair in it. The server was called and she brought another guy with her.And the guy said that they were extremely sorry for the hair fiasco.They took the old plate and brought me a new plate.This time I was a little sceptic about the food.But,thankfully,there was no hair. :P But the dish tasted yummy.The smell of cheese did increase my appetite.

The vegetable polao was good.I will definitely recommend this to others.Chicken butter masala was alright.

Kadhai paneer was good.Garlic nun was okayish,not as good as expected.

The desert looked great but I found nothing except a dollop of whipped cream and a liquidy substance.

All in all,the experience was good.The staffs were courteous.

2017-03-11 09:50:19
Chandni Chakraborty
27089110
4.5
Scoop does not needs an introduction in a different way. It is a place where you will find everything to eat be it Indian, Chinese, Continental or Mughlai. Since when I was introduced to Scoop by one of my friends, I always tried their chicken keema dosa, which is out of the box & obviously tasty. I never thought of trying anything else. But recently I went their with my friend & tried their continental part of menu & I must say they almost excel in that also. CHUMP CHAMP CHICKEN GRILL, a treat to your taste buds, creamy, succulent chicken in that extremely yummilicious sauce with sauted vegetables & buns. 2017-03-01 19:44:51
Sujata Thaker
30203195
4.0
Very colourful interiors....Once you step into the restaurant you are bombarded with bright colours from all sides. It adds to the informal and peppy atmosphere. The service staff are good, our server was Sangita and she went about her work smilingly and pleasantly. She even gave her suggestions about which icecream to have but in a gentle and mild manner, not overly aggressive but gently persuasive. Waiting time after the order was given was also moderate. Had paneer tikka and it was good, soft and succulent paneer pieces with tandoori masala and cooked well in tandoor with slightly charred edges giving it a smoky flavour. The pudina dip which accompanied it was tangy and tasty. The onions salad too added to the taste. The icecream, new one, strawberry cheesecake was excellent. 
But I feel that this place is somewhat overpriced. 
Otherwise good place.

If you are shopping at New Market throughout the day and you are tired and hungry, Scoop is the place to go. I've been here twice and even though the place is crowded and the service isn't quite fast, the food and desserts will completely satiate your hunger.

2017-02-12 14:38:13
AVERY BANERJEE
34793859
3.5
I've been to this place a lot of times. The service is usually slow but the food is good and affordable. They have launched a new item, Creamy Baked Fish. On the whole, it's a nice dish. A thick fillet of fish well baked and topped with mozzarella cheese. It's served with roasted broccolis, potatoes and onions. A dash of lime in the potatoes would have made a world of difference. The palate became a little boring at times. I would like to make a special mention of Ms. Sanju Singh who was extremely courteous and went out of her way to make the visit memorable unlike my past experiences at the restaurant. I also tried the blackforest milkshake. It was not extraordinary,but  it was good.

2017-02-10 12:36:06
Sthita Prangya Mohanty
37114848
4.0
The New Market Area, the shopping hub has always been crowded with the fashion lovers. But, the place is quite popular among the foodies too and if you‚Äôre one among them, Scoop can be your pick. This is a perfect place to relish multiple cuisine; from South Indian to Chinese; from North Indian to Italian. Besides, a wide range of luscious desserts is there to be selected from. 

Last time, I went there to get some quality time with my dear buddies and had Chicken Sizzler, Chicken Salad and BB Chicken Burger. The Chicken Sizzler was a must have preparation that you would like to relish again and again. The salad was a perfect blend of lettuce and onion along with chicken tikka. Quite naturally, the taste of the dish was ravishing and state-of-the-art too. In addition, the burger, which was simply yummy, deserves complete appreciation. The grilled chicken was perfectly mixed with the mouth-watering BBQ sauce and the delicious cheddar cheese. The flavor and daintiness offered by the melted cheese totally mesmerized me.

2017-02-01 15:49:41
Bikash Burnwal
15743657
4.5
In spite of being the heaven for the ice cream lovers the Scoop of New Market also performs a prominent duty of keeping the taste-buds of everyone happy by serving delicious dishes. The place is a bit crowded, but all the waiting will actually come out to be beneficial after having a bite of their unique cuisine. Our last week‚Äôs visit to this awesome place actually became fruitful due to the variety of dishes served in the outlet. 

The ambiance of the food parlor was absolutely brilliant and the nice background  music of the place goes perfectly well with their marvelous food items. The dishes we decided to try consisted of chicken sizzler, chicken salad and BBQ chicken burger. The freshness of the lettuce and onions could easily be felt with every bite of the Chicken Salad we had. The pieces of the chicken used in making the salad were quite big. The BBQ Chicken Burgers we ordered were also very delicious. The chicken used in making the burger was perfectly grilled and the BBQ sauce, paprika, and cheddar cheese used in the burger made the dish more delicious. The Chicken Sizzler was also a mention worthy dish. 

The affordable price along with the wide range of food items are enough for the people to pick the outlet as a cool hangout place with their pals.

##

2017-01-20 02:37:36
Devlin Chanda
1415183
3.5
Second visit here. Quite crowded, expected when you're bang in the middle of New Market. Known for its desserts but didn't try any.

Ordered the chicken cheese burger. OK. Served not with French fries but with the home made potato chips. The burger could have done with a bit more molten cheese, since the patty was dry. But it was tasty, and gets you full.

Chicken nuggets were really good. Soft, succulent. Fish fingers were disappointing. This is one dish I have everywhere I go, and this was too dry. Also, they don't serve it with tartar sauce, so another drawback that. Only reason I'm rating it 3.5 instead of 4.

The visit to SCOOP was the result of a very sudden planning. Standing amidst new market we surfed zomato for a nearby place to have our lunch.. And scoop unexpectedly happened to us and more unexpectedly left us awe-stricken with what it had to offer. 
The first thing which hit us and for which the restaurant stands out is the ambience.. Just awesome. There is something very innocent, soothing and refreshing about the ambience. The interiors are very beautifully decorated with thermocol art. There is pinkish hue in the interiors created by the lights renders the place a childish attitude. The awesome music also adds to the beauty of this place. 
Next coming to food they have a pretty interesting menu card at least the new anglo indian section to be precise. They have added  a lot of innovative continental dishes in this new section. We ordered - 
UNCLE DENZIL MUTTON STEAK (from the new anglo indian potluck menu) - slightly gravy mutton steak served with mashed potatoes and vegetables. The mutton was soft and juicy. Tasted awesome. Even the mashed potato was tasty. 
INDONESIAN CHILLY NOODLES WITH CHICKEN SATAY (from the old menu) -  noodles served with 4 pieces of kabab-like fried chicken. Very innovatively delicious. 
FROZEN COCO- SCOOP is famous for their desserts. And this item does justice to their fame. This is also one of their new additions and most importantly comes at a very cheap rate. Consists of layers of cream with  a cherry on top with ice cold coco beneath. A perfect happy ending to an awesome meal.
Now regarding the pocket pinch,  I found SCOOP to be very much pocket friendly. The portions they serve is for one person and not adequate for sharing. But still considering the quality it is way more reasonable than other joints in the city and that too being located in the heart of kolkata. More importantly they DO NOT CHARGE THE EXTRA SERVICE CHARGE. That is a relief for sure. 
Once i learnt that  often the greatest pleasures comes in the most unexpected ways. Scoop just set a perfect example for that!! 
Bon apetit

dish.It consisted 1 piece of fish,1 piece of Mutton And and a large chunk of Grilled Chicken,served with rice and a Sunny side up egg.It was really delicious and a must try dish for all.

The shake was insane and wonderful.

We had to pay Rs-716/- for these two dish and yes they did charge additional taxes.

##

2016-10-30 10:09:33
Vivek Saini
113381
3.0
I've often passed by this place,  since it's situated at the heart of a bustling new market area. I believe the interiors have recently been re-done. It looks more like a flashy,  fancy joint for kids with all the vibrant colours. Huge menu,  though I'm not sure if everything is available. When I visited,  sandwiches were unavailable. We ordered penne in tangy tomato sauce and a plate of fish and chips. The food tastes good,  without any doubt. However the saddest part of the whole experience has been the staff. I hate to say this,  especially when I see how the serving staff is normally overworked in restaurants. But this was a cold treatment on a whole new level. Within a min. of occupying our table,  a guy comes to us for order. Like,  seriously? Then he asks us if we wanted a regular or bottled water. Upon asking for a regular one,  he gives an extremely weird smile (as if almost saying : bah! Regular weirdos,  can't afford a thing). Please note,  it's not just me, my friend felt the same as well. Then within,  3 mins. Another person comes for order and we hadn't even gone through have the menu. After this we really had to crane out necks out and call someone to place an order. Apparently,  the staff wasn't even aware if the  sandwiches are grilled or not. All in all,  we got a bill of Rs. 480 approx. I'd certainly not wish to go back to such a cold treatment. I could've rated lower,  but I really appreciate the chef's work. I wish the management reads this review and makes some improvements.

##

2016-10-09 16:25:09
Amrita Mondal
36255179
5.0
Firstly, it's a place from kolkatan dessert legend. Secondly, this is where you go to chill out - literally and metaphorically. This is the ultimate hang out with friends,the more the merrier. Thirdly, there is a wide range of cuisine to choose from - sumptuous sizzlers to sassy south Indian.
My personal favourite is the famous slurpy Cantonese mixed noodles and fish. Their pizzas will put the current international brands to shame with the sizeable portions, generous toppings and fulfilling mouthfuls of cheese. North Indian dishes are great too. Momos are yummy. Every item is palate pleasing.
The place is spacious and the decor is unobnoxiously funky, done up by the proprietress . The setting is inviting for a mega gossip session with friends and family. The place is surprisingly affordable as well, even though it is a part of kolkata's hospitality history. Kids to grannies - there is something for everyone. A spiderman positioned outside on an English park bench has been the photo companion of numerous visitors from India and abroad.
The place has always been a dessert haunt so I am not writing much about the desserts. Remember, it is one of the first sundae-serving parlours in kolkata. So go and scoop some definitely after a hearty meal. This is not a place to visit in a hurry. It is a place to relax and enjoy, gossip and eat.

2016-10-06 10:07:51
Kolkata Epicurean
9516701
4.5
Location-New market area,Kolkata.

Have crave for freak shakes or icecream fusions?Then scoop is the place to satisfy your desire.Scoop is one of the oldest and legendary restaurant of Kolkata.Few years back it was only known for its sundaes but now this place is like an all rounder cricketer which is also famous for its shakes and food.You will usually find this place crowded and during pujas  you have to wait in cue to reserve a seat in this restaurant.It has two outlets in the city and serves Italian,Chinese,North Indian,Continental and South Indian cuisines.And during festive season they always have a special menu along with regular menu.

Service-The service at this place was extremely fast and reliable.The staff is too cooperative and helpful.Inspite of such a heavy crowd they served us the whole order in 10-12 minutes which was quite impressive.

Ambiance-The ambiance at this place is quite noisy but the interiors which is mostly in pink colored theme is impressive.It also has a two floored huge seating capicity.

Food-The food at this place is fingerlicking.And only one question was constantly striking our mind and it was"How so cheap?."This place also serves a huge variety in food and now during pujas in their special menu they are serving freak shakes which is served by extremely limited restaurant in kolkata.We had-
1:Masala idly
2:Big mama
3:Chola bhatura 
4:Veg seekh kebab

All the item were great in taste but the presentation of "BIG MAMA"just blew our mind.

Food-4.5/5
Service-5/5
Ambiance-4/5

A visit to this place is highly recommended especially if you are a dessert lover.üòÉüòÉ

##

2016-09-17 17:00:32
Shamayita Sen
3150383
4.0
Well, how to start this uniquely special review!! Am just so excited. First of all, a big THANK YOU to team Zomato, you people define awesomeness. It was around June and I was busy preparing for my final semester examination. I distinctly remember the day -  I was thoroughly bored and was waiting for something exciting to happen. My phone beeped as I received a notification from Gmail. To my utter surprise the mail was from Zomato! I was asked to give my personal address and phone number. In return they promised to give me a nice surprise! My day was made and I began to anticipate as to what's on store for me! The very next day I received a letter just to find a voucher inside it. Zomato offered me a free meal in Scoop which I needed to avail before 15th September. That was my butterflies in the stomach moment! ;) 

On the very last day that is on 15th September I went to Scoop. Its located on the ground floor of the New empire building at New market, opposite to Wow Momo and Dominos. Blame my superbly hectic schedule for the delay. Initially, I was a bit jittery for I had never ever gone to dine alone. As instructed, I called the restaurant up and confirmed reservation. I was there within 10 minutes of making the call and was greeted by a lady with a very warm smile. Within minutes a young guy approached me with a large menu card and I was literally starving. I ordered JAP CHICKEN, SPAGHETTI WITH MEATBALLS, DARK TEMPTATION AND PEPSI. 

JAP CHICKEN- 8 small pieces of succulent boneless chicken in a unique sauce. The dish was very spicy but not hot! Just the way I like it. 

SPAGHETTI WITH MEATBALLS - this dish was pretty disappointing. While the quantity was impressive the taste was not! It was way too tangy and failed to impress my taste buds. Blame dollops of tomato ketchup for the same. Meatballs were small but spicy. Likeable. This dish needs improvement, but.

DARK TEMPTATION - Ah! This one was a clear winner. Heard a lot about their ice creams and trust me I will go back again exclusively for this. It was a unique concoction of Vanilla ice cream, Chocolate ice cream, chocolate sauce and almond. An absolute delight for all ice cream lovers. I took my own sweet time to relish this delicacy and boy! I was just so content. 

SERVICE - Staffs are amazing and courteous. They are pretty attentive and responsive, which is a bonus! They are also very well trained and are experts in managing crowds. 

OVERALL EXPERIENCE -  Good. Totally Recommended. Oh! I loved the ambience. A tiny fairy land in the heart of an ever busy Esplanade!

2016-09-09 12:41:03
Akash
29069086
4.0
Scoop is a must visit Restaurant in New Market Area..I have visited there several time during my childhood when I went to New Market with my parents during puja shopping‚Ä¶.I was mainly a good dining place for those people who went New Market for shopping, but after their renovation u can consider it as a dating place also‚Ä¶
Location : It is very easy to find in New Market, located into the bottom floor of New Empire building just beside of WOW! Momo and KFC.
Decoration : After their renovation they added very much Pink in their shop..Very well decorated, big space, clean and no question left for the hygiene level, red colored light is set on roof and the restaurant easily can hold an capacity of 50 people..
Management : Very responsive and very polite too‚Ä¶They help customer to choose the right dish according to their taste.
Food : Well, Scoop serves a large amount of dish of different cuisine. From the South Indian dish to Italian, Mexican they serves all kinda food.They has a huge dish containing menu book which is really makes us difficult to choose what to eat. But after seeing some reviews and guidance on Zomato, we all the following item‚Ä¶..
Creamy Cheese Sauce Pasta (Non veg and Penne) : Well I am not a fan of pasta and all cheesy things, but still I become a fan of there Pasta. In one word it was just mind blowing. Full cheesy and can feel the perfection of the dish, each time you take a spoonful of pasta. The pasta melts into my mouth every time you take a bite. Very much recommended here. You can also try the pasta in Spaghetti variation also.
Spicy Chilly Garlic Noodles with Jap Chicken : In the main course, we ordered this one and it was really a Bulls eye for us. The dish was served in a bowl which looks great. Thin and well fried noodles with 4 mid sized chicken pieces are there in the dish. The noodles was mixed with sufficient amount of well chopped veggies. Chicken pieces were well cooked. The gravy in which the chicken pieces are served was rich spicy but not too hot, which is a really noticeable point. The quantity is sufficient for one persons, overall must try main course here.
Puppy Love : Scoop was and is famous for its legendary ice-cream. When I come early, I had tried Tutty Frutty. So this time want to try something different and ordered this one. Served with two scoop of Strawberry and one scoop of vanilla and cream on top. Gems are putted into the cream, which is really an eye catching. It tastes good but not as good like the Tutty Frutty that I tried last time. Overall good.

In conclusion, it is very obvious noticeable that Scoop has upgrade its quality in huge amount after its renovation. A must try destination at New Market area. Every item is affordable and they have a huge variety of food, All items they served are really made of love and you can surely feel it. Thanks to Zomato for the meal voucher they send to my friend
