##

2016-08-31 21:23:20
Nitika
1898766
4.0
Thanks to the voucher given by Zomato, I got to know about this place. The interiors are mostly pink, with a friendly and caring staff and good food. We ordered a pizza, chola bhatura, veg burger and the chilli garlic noodles with jap chicken. Everything was good. The pizza was thin and simple, with juicy slices of tomatoes and jalapenos. The burger was okay, and the fries they were served with were really crispy. The chola bhatura had a few mistakes. Though the bhatura was perfectly ballooned up and was thick like how it's supposed to be, the chola lacked the necessary spices and was suspended in a lot of oil. But overall it didn't taste so bad. Coming to the chilli garlic noodles and jap chicken, the chicken had an unusual flavour and tasted good. It was cooked perfectly too. The noodles were nice and spicy , so they brought the whole dish together and they were the highlight of the day. For desserts we had this dessert called the puppy love where there were three scoops of ice cream ; vanilla, strawberry and chocolate with sauces and whipped cream. It was really good. I had always thought of Scoop as a dessert parlour and it is true that it should be treated as one. It is a reasonable place and had good food. Definitely going here again.

##

2016-08-23 10:31:04
Shahrukh Ahmed
15540184
4.5
One fine morning, I rose to an email from Zomato asking me to send my postal address for a gift. Though, it was not my birthday, I was too greedy for a gift and hence gave them the same. After a span of four days, I received a gift coupon for Scoop and that is the time, I made it on my bucket list to visit. However, the actual visit came after many months and well it was worthy.
I called up my best buddy to accompany me and also click few pics of the same to which he happily agreed being a photo bluff. We reached the eatery around seven in the evening and was greeted by a sweet lady who directed us to get seated. Just as we got chatting on what to order, a guy came with plenty of menus in hand and hence was standing in for us to order. We asked him to wait as our order choice would take some time.
Spending some time reading the menu, we ordered for a combo of BBQ Cottage Cheese Sandwich, Chicken Nuggets, French Fries and a Pepsi. The guy took our order and got it delivered in about 10 minutes. While being eagerly seated for food, I observed that the music was rather loud. However, the staff‚Äôs courtesy was one to look after as they are truly gem. Upon arrival the meal was less in quantity than expected. The BBQ was kinda okay but starting from nuggets to drinks all were minimal in quantity and shooed off really fast. To fill in our stomachs we ordered for Indonesian Smoked Noodles which did not taste any good in my mouth. Dejected at it, I ordered for three kinds of ice creams which they took a little while to prepare but it is worth it.
The Creme Brulee with Choco Chips gave nice flavour to one‚Äôs mouth so as the Mango Paluda with Ice Cream. However, the real amazement lies with the Pehla Nasha which contains two scoops of ice creams and a branch of Black Forest Cake. It also have had a firework attached to it which can be lit if anyone wished to. Forgetting our meal, we drooled upon the desert which tasted really good. Thus, we happily concluded our meal and to the itching question as to why the desert section was placed on the first page of the menu.

Qs) Should you visit it?
Ans) Of course you can pay them a visit and be sure to try the desserts.

Qs) Why have I rated them 4.5 stars?
Ans) Normally, in situations like this I offer to rate 4 stars, but, solely the staffs hospitality and warmness made to add up half a star.

##

2016-07-30 18:09:50
Vishal Kumar
15078751
4.5
Scoop Eat n Run is undoubtedly my favorite place and I go there very frequently. It's more like my kind of place.

Ambient : Nothing fancy about the place it's very simple and crafted beautifully keeping youths in mind. Pink color plays the major role here and even staffs dress color is pink may be it's owner's favorite color. :p Nonetheless you will like this place cos it's nice. Plenty of place to sit however I am yet to try out the seating arrangements upstairs which I believe was operational earlier but not anymore.

Staffs : The great thing about this place is the friendly staffs who always welcomes you with a smile and since I am very frequent I know some of them quite well now. Sanju, Sangita and Suman this 3 in particular are the most friendliest guys over here and they make you like this place even more with their commendable service.

Menu with a twist : Menu is huge and you get plenty of items from sandwich to biryani all available here. And one biggest plus point of this place is the experiment they do with new dishes which are more like seasonal special menu which changes every 3 months and I love that alot.

Pricing : Well pricing is decent and nothing to complain about. On a average for me everytime I go with my girlfriend the bill is around 400-700 which according to me is very reasonable as you get to eat alot too.

My favorite : Pop Chicken is a must try and you simply cannot miss that. Then Penne Arabiata Pasta with red sauce and chicken. French fries here great too but now my girlfriend won't let me eat that :( and like that there's plenty of good dishes which you gotta try yourself.

I highly recommend this place to everyone and their Special seasonal menu is a must try. Currently it's mango season so do try out their Mango Glory, Mango Firni, Aam Candy and Eggs-quse-me if you get.

Had gone to New Market for some work. Was lunch time, so saw this restaurant. Dropped by to check it out. As the pictures suggest, very attractive interiors! Was given a seat immediately! Everything was going alright as of now. Water was served in stainless steel glass, which I liked. 

Had ordered ‚Ä¢ Tango ( special dish ) consisting of tandoor chicken and dhaniya rice ! 

                      ‚Ä¢ Veg rice with chilly fish !

Asked for Lassi, but was informed by Mr. Suman that it's no more available. Fine, understandable.

Now, it was over 20 minutes, none of the food items was on the table. So I asked Mr. Shounak - the young man serving us, about the food. He was on the way and from the other end another female staff was bringing my food. She kept the food on the table, since there were already cutlery on the table, I took the extra ones in my hand to give it back. The lady almost snatched it from my hands. Wow ! Suddenly I looked around to make me realise that I am not sitting in a road side dhaba, but was surprised to feel the reality with the behaviour of this female staff. 

The rice was bloody cold and the chicken had lost its softness and was cold too ! Informed Mr. Shounak about this, to my surprise even he said the same thing which I was thinking, the cold tasteless dhaniya rice was heated in microwave and served. It was on special today. To the COOK ( and not chef ) - LEAVE THE JOB IF You CANT COOK, BUT DONT SERVE COLD MICROWAVED FOOD. Bloody hell. Was surprised with the audacity. 

Now, till now my partner didn't receive her food, and my food was getting colder since I was waiting for her food to come, so that we can have lunch together. 

To the waiters - Please get your basics straight. It's important to have the meal on the table at the same time when people are eating together, and not wait for another 10 minutes for the other dish to land on the table. Job of a waiter is not to just pick up food and dump it on the table, it's all about looking after the guests who come to your restaurant to have a good meal, and pay the price for it. 

Please go to a good place and dine, you will understand the difference between your service and theirs !

2016-06-23 15:00:55
Dr.Adwaita Nag
221626
3.5
Iv visited Scoop many times since childhood, but yesterday was my first visit in the last couple of years... The decor is still the same, colourful and vibrant. What immediately caught my eye was the revamped menu.. The menu card was attractive as were the dishes being displayed on the wall-mounted display boards.. Moreover they had a very innovative offer going on - special discounts for each day of the week - provided u wore black&white clothes or u had an elderly/kid in your group etc... Really really impressive...  A particular lampshade also caught my eye with the handle being made of inverted cups and kettles...
 Our group consisted of quite a few vegetarians, and so we ordered a motley of dishes - the best of both worlds.. Among veg, we ordered  
Spaghetti in Tomato Basil sauce and Veg Au Gratin - both were yummmy... The Chef's Veg Special Sizzler looked delectable but wasnt suited for my non-veg 'steak-y' palate..  I ordered a Penne in Cheese Spinach Sauce, Dry Chilli Chicken and Chicken Cheese Sandwich - all were tasty.... Despite being full, we also ordered 3 milkshakes as they looked absolutely mouthwatering in their picture in the menu - Oreo Cookie, Black Forest, Kitkat.... Unfortunately, apart from the Black forest one, (which had generous amounts of blended pastry crumbs) the others were a tad too dilute..
The bill was around 2.3 k..  
Scoop is one of those old joints which still remains a favourite among us Kolkattans.. overall a good place to hang out with friends over snacks.. and a welcome break from the new age pricey hookah/sports/lounge cafes... This one is just a Cafe !!! And a great 1 !!

2016-06-12 00:17:00
Ejazz Ahmed
549488
3.5
This age old restaurant has been around for i don't know how long, I used to visit this place with my parents when I was a kid‚Äì we would mostly eat their sizzlers and ice cream sundaes. And boy their sizzlers were good, if my memory serves me right. 

Recently visited the place after what I believe is a millennium, to be welcomed at a whole new and different version of scoop from what i can remember. 
Enough of the nostalgia, let's jump to business. 
Food. I would say i was happy with it, with whatever i ordered but nit something that would draw me back to the place. Ordered the classic‚Äì chicken sizzler, which I'd say is an above average steaked sizzler, the sauce is rather subtle and nice, though i expected the sizzler to sizzle for a while I don't remember hearing it sizzle as it arrived at the table. 
Apart from that we ordered some crispy chicken pepper which were pretty good and the drinks that accompanied our food were decent.

What I'd really recommend this place for is the staff‚Äì one of the most well behaved and friendly restaurant staff I've come across in my recent visits to restaurants in general. They even offered a complimentary piece of cake which wasn't on the menu, and was currently being experimented‚Äì as in the ingredients and how it ought to be made. And to be honest, the cake was indeed really good. 
And if you're the kind of person who likes to be on the phone whilst eating sumptuous food, this place offers free Wi-Fi, so a brownie point for that! 

Overall I'd say the place hasn't retained it's 90's charm with the all new jazzy colourful decor but they certainly have a good team and decent food to keep you interested. I think I'd visit them for the ice creams again. Cheers!

##

2016-06-09 22:41:51
Oishik Sarkar
3119605
4.0
I am writing on Zomato for a long now. Being an expertise I don't know how I missed this beautiful place at New Market. Well Zomato noticed that & gave a surprise treat by providing me a voucher of One of The Legendary Desert Parlour of Kolkata, Yes its Scoop.

First of all, I want to thank Zomato from my bottom of heart for giving all the food lovers such an opportunity to share their experiences in a decent way that not just help other foodies also creats its own world & community.

This message is for all the new beginner foodies on Zomato. Zomato has the most largest database of Restaurants in the World. That is because of all the foodies like us posting photos, menus, reviews & sharing our experiences with them. 

Well all of this things not just making their database strong day by day, now it also has became a hobby in our life. Zomato respects all of this efforts silently & they doesn't hesitate to love you back for all your efforts. And here's the proof, My dinner in Scoop was provided by Zomato.

Now lets talk about the restaurant. Scoop is quite popular between college goers young stars and love birds. Why not it should be, they provide some excellent numbers of desert options while they offer a beautiful dining too.

Location : Scoop is located on the ground floor of New Empire Building at New Market. Its just between  KFC and Domino's. This building is quite famous hence the restaurant is quite easy to find.

Decorations : Like all the other reviews says this one is a pink world. But I would like to call it a colorful world. Scoop is very very well decorated with funky colors that just punches your eyes & not only that those colors matches with their colorful deserts on your table. Colourful walls, Colourful chair tables, Wall posters, Led display panels showing their special menu items, Led strip lights everywhere, all of this not just creates a funky theme, it also makes a Romantic ambience. Scoop's ambience is perfect if you are thinking about to take your girl out for a romantic dinner. Unfortunately no date for me this time :p.

Staffs & Management : There were waiter & waitresses in different dress codes. They were well trained, well behaved & well mannered. From the time we entered into the restaurant to guide us through the menu they helped us really well in every angle. After placing the order they took a very short time to serve us. They have also done a pro degree on garnishing foods & that was totally seen in every item they served us. After a dish or two they even asked for our feedback about the food was good or not. They pleased us very very well. Excellent Service, A big point goes for them.

Foods : Scoop covers a large number of cuisines from  Italian, Chinese, South Indian, North Indian, Deserts & of course Ice Cream. So their menu card seems like a food dictionary too. Their colourful menu card is so big that a pro foodie can fall in little confusion. After seeing a number of reviews I came to a conclusion what should we order.

Creamy Cheese Sauce Penne Pasta with a combination of Cheese, Butter & Cream : 
The flavour of cheese covered up the place as soon it came to our table. In a single glace I observed that it was made with real perfection & love. It was served really well. The first bite of this just melts into the mouth. The dish tasted extremely cheesy & creamy. Very light spices were used but it holds up the taste really long. In simple words, It was such delicious that words can't explain. Creamy Cheese Sauce Pasta was very much preferable for me & an absolute recommended over here.

Spicy Chilly Garlic Noodles with Jap Chicken :
Wow, to the way it was served in a bowl. It looked like Chinese heaven. Noodles were very thin & very well fried. There was kind of mixed flavour of smoke & tangy sauce in the noodles, that was mixed with nicely sliced vegetables. The best part was yet to come. The chicken pieces tasted like heaven. A juicy cheesy flavor was coming from inside & that just melted into the mouth. The dish was very spicy but fortunately not very hot, just absolute likeable. By the way the quantity was average & there were 4 pieces of chicken in it, that would suite 1 person perfectly. Overall the dish tasted mind blowing & another must have over here.

Puppy Love : Now coming to their legendary ice cream. I was bit confused before ordering, between Eye Candy & Puppy Love. Then I thought Eye Candy is good for groups cause it comes with 5 scoops of ice cream. So I shatteled down with Puppy Love that came with 2 scoops of Strawberry & 1 scoop of vanilla served in a glass with full of cream on top. Oh, did I mentioned that colourful Cadbury Gems & choco chips were on it. Well my expectation for this was gone really high that time. Unfortunately it tasted very very simple. The ice cream felt good & all the common taste of other things that was used to make it were visible. It was perfect for two people to have. However it didn't surprised me with its taste that much. It wasn't bad either but an improvement can be done highly on it.

Pricing : Our bill for 2 with all the above mentioned items were Rs. 635. For me Zomato paid it all, So thanks to Zomato once again. Coming to the pricing segment I think for all the beautiful ambience, excellent service & delicious foods their prices are decently balanced that satisfies your pocket well.

Conclusion : Scoop is a restaurant that has been extracted from the Rainbow. Its a lovely colorful world inside, that is perfect to feel with your loved once over some sweet dishes made by them. Its an absolute recommend place from my side, even I am planing to visit this in near future too.

##

2016-05-11 23:32:31
Sohini Sarkar
33862921
3.5
Have a weet tooth and in dire need of biting into a pretty looking, icy, creamy dish to beat the heat this summer? Look no further. Scoop is the place where you ought to be.

Location: a few minutes walk from Esplanade Metro Station. Scoop is located at the heart of New Market, or if specifically asked New Empire Building. In other and simpler words, take a left from KFC. You'd find Scoop to your right.

Food: Scoop is a wonderland for all the people out there who likes pretty places and pretty desserts. Known for both its decorative and innovative ways of plating sweet stuff, this place is a must go!

Creamy Pasta with Chicken: perfectly cooked penne smothered in delicious white sauce and seasoned delightfully right. I have never had as good as a white sauce pasta as this before. The meat was tender and soft and the cream went well with it. (5/5)

Chicken Steak: pieces of chicken breast accompanied with saut√©ed mushroom smeared in thick sauce. Frankly, there are better chicken steaks out there. The flavours did not pan out for me. The Steak was served with grilled vegetables on the side which included carrots, cauliflower, broccoli and beans, which were a bit too plain. (2.5/5)

Eye Candy: the star among the three course meal has to be Eye Candy. Five scoops of ice creams served in cones with a side of cotton candy. This dessert deserves a round of applause because of its quite unique presentation in a rather limited budget. The menu allows you to pick your favourite ice creams among an unusually large stretch of flavours. Few of the flavours that they features are: Tutty Fruity: a combination of fruits in an ice cream (3.5/5); Chocolate Chips- creamy chocolatey delight with sudden surprises of chocolate chips in bites [con: there are much better chocolate ice creams out there than this] (2.5/5); Strawberry Cheese Cake- strawberry flavoured ice cream with cheese cake [con: cheese cake flavour was missing] (3/5); Cr√®me br√ªl√©e- sweet creamy ice cream with a hint of strawberry (4/5).

Management: this pink, pretty place comes with a team of fast working, courteous staff. Service here is a fast. Cleanliness is spot on. Full marks on the decor. You running a tight budget wouldn't stop you from grabbing a bite here, because the place is very pocket friendly too.

2016-05-07 17:47:33
Dipyaman Basu (whenstomachtickles)
627356
3.5
Its been many many years, since I had visited them last, so this review of mine is definitely not going to reflect on their current state.

Perhaps, the most popular places in and around Explanade region, Scoop has been an obvious destination for youngsters since the past couple of years, whenever it meant having quality food accompanied with some chit-chat. The first time I had dropped in here was some 12 years back. I loved the ambiance. A bit hard to describe by as I haven't been there in years, but I can easily recollect the bright lightnings and the friendly staffs.

I began to be a regular here after the bar at Lighthouse had shut down. Their Thai Section was shifted to Scoop and I have no shame in admitting, that I was a die-hard fan of their Chicken in Oyster Sauce. One or two common staffs, who were also transfer ed to Scoop, I had absolutely no issues in communicating with them. It was even later, that the Thai Section again got shifted to a brand new restaurant just beside Scoop, which was perhaps known as the 'The Oriental Plaza'.

Apart from the Thai Offerings, I loved their drinks. Good shakes (As I can recollect) was one of my obvious choice to quench the thirst. Their food however was mostly inconsistent. I remember of having visited them sometime int he year 2009 or 2010, and me and my friend were served with two horrible tasting sizzlers. We had to desert out food in the midway, and instead go to Aminia to complete our meal.

Not that I am complaining, perhaps things have changed for good in the past couple of years. May be it hasn't. But Scoop will always remain special to me, for the ¬†sheer memories I have had at this place, with my friends. Hope to find the familar face of the captain from Lighthouse Bar once again. :-)

##

2016-04-25 10:56:51
Debashish Dey - Petukbangali.com
424506
4.5
Well nowadays you have everything in your city right !! The European delicacies, the Mexican , Spanish , more than countable mughlai and Chinese outlets . But amongst all these there lies some very few joints which have its on charm and no matter wherever you go you won't find it anywhere else .

So, you are with your loved one and hopping around new market and suddenly feel hungry "Scoop" should be one of your top destinations . I love the seating arrangements where the tables are located in various nook and corners of the restaurant as a result of which you can always enjoy a cosy time with your beloved . You will get a mix culture of people coming in since it is located at the heart of new market . 

Those arijit Singh and ankit tiwari songs will transform you to a hopelessly romantic type of a mood if you are into that sort of stuff . You won't get into fine dining almost everyday in your curriculum. 

Location :- Very easy to find . Ground floor of New empire of cinema hall.

Food :- Now the most important part , scoop offers a variety of choices starting from sizzlers, fish fry , burgers , sandwiches , milkshakes , coolers ,ice teas and also Chinese and mughlai . You name it and they will serve it .  We although decided to have the following : -

--------------------------------------------------------------
        STARTERS
-------------------------------------------------------------
1. Fish Fingers ( 5 / 5 ) :- Although this is pocket pinch restaurant I wondered how can a plate of fish finger cost 194 rupees but I was too hungry and craving for some fingers so I ordered it and it simply won my heart . I have attached the pic so you can clearly see how they are served . Served in a basket which is on a top of wooden plate . And they had added some mayonese and potato chips as add ons . I promise you those were some delightfully tasty fish fingers . There were 8 pieces which we munched upon delightfully .
 
2. Eggs Nest ( 3.5 / 5 ) :- This was more of an experimental try . These are basically poached eggs served as sunny side up upon some deep fried potatoes . The fried potatoes " jhuri alu bhaja " looks like a birds nest and the egg yolk upon in looks absolutely yummy . The only problem with this dish was it was less salty . If you put a little salt on it , trust me these are 2 little pieces of delicious egg bombs .

--------------------------------------------------------------
  MAIN COURSE
-------------------------------------------------------------

1. Chicken cheese burger (4 / 5 ) :- With true honesty this was a nice burger . Not over exaggerated the party was yummy and had adequate cheese to make it a super cheesy experience with every bite . To me the burger was a winner .

-------------------------------------------------------------
 DESERTS & COOLERS
-------------------------------------------------------------
 
1. Vanilla milk shake ( 5 / 5 ) :- You can't say you ever had a bad vanilla milk shake because it is one hell of a combo . Served in a quite big proportion it was enough for 2 of us to quench our thirst especially when we were having the burger . 

2. Miss sparkle bunny vanilla ice cream ( 10 / 5 ) :- Yes that's how I will rate this dish . Firstly , the presentation was beautiful . The ice cream was served in a wine glass with plastic flowers beneath it . It was once again on top of a wooden plate . And accompanying it was a toy bunny which on shaking it glowed . It was so childish that we laughed the hell out of it . The ice cream was yummy , vanilla was mixed with coconut and served with bourbon biscuits . I will never forget this dish . It's a bummer that they took away the bunny in the end as it was only for show . But by then, it had already won our hearts .

Service : - The staff is really very attentive and they will help you with everything you need .

 Sometimes you have to adjust urself with the places you are visiting , once again I am stressing this that you won't find a fine dining experience everywhere . But in scoop you will get your wishes fulfilled . Do try their snacks as they are not popular for their main dishes . We had a wonderful time today and whenever I am in new market , scoop will always be in my mind .

------

2016-04-05 21:57:58
Rishabh Singh
33766326
3.5
Scoop had become my grandmother's and mine personal favourite for around 6 months I guess. The place is really  pretty and is always full! We used to come here quite often and I must say, they serve some really good food. I have had lots of dishes here. 
Flaming Chilly Prawns were my favourite. Mind you, the batter on the prawns is a bit soggy but I somehow like soggy batters! So Yay!
The Chicken Fried Rice which has egg as well is very very tasty. It's got minimal ingredients but it still tastes great! The Sweet corn soup is disappointing as the balance is missing more often than not. On the other hand the cream of spinach soup is really tasty! 
I had once ordered grilled fish as well, and may I say... Wow! The fish was really amazing! Their south indian food is quite popular but I am not very keen about south indian food, so never tried it. The desserts are also really nice. They aren't nearly the best in the city but they are always pleasing. 
Now the reason this "was" my favourite restaurant is because recently the quality seemed to have dropped and as a result the price that earlier seemed fine to pay suddenly started to pinch. I am saying this on the back of multiple "average" visits of late and not just one day. Besides, any place can have a bad day! Buy here, I am positive there's a quality drop. 
I know the capability of this place very well and I hope to see it improve and reestablish its earlier set high standards! Good Luck! And yes, you must give this restaurant atleast one shot! Happy Dining!!

Overall a decent place to hang out with your friends and yes I will be going back to check out what's new.

2016-01-26 11:06:33

11928401
4.5
This outlet of Scoop is situated at ground floor of new empire building in New Market near Esplanade Metro station...
After shopping at Big Bazar ,when our tummies were starving for foods we decided to go to Scoop... Watching the rating 3.2 of Scoop in zomato I didn't have so much expectations from the place...
but after having the lunch ...let me tell you that I don't believe the rating should be so low it should be minimum 4 ...
The Decoration and the Ambience is very much attractive and beautifully organised ... Food was also good ...
They have lots of items from multi cuisine... but the best part about them is the desserts specially the icecreams...
We had
German Potato Salad
Spanish Omlette with Potatoes
Quick Gun Murg Gun Pizza
Sizzler
Pehla Nasha with sparkle
Confused Identity
Hot Dark Chocolate
Now the names of every dishes there were very funny and attractive...
German potato salad was salads and potatoes mixed in mayonnaise and the plate was placed on ice cubes ... it was scrumptious...
Spanish omelette was mix of one thick omelette, two sandwiches, mushrooms and veggies... tastes good...
Pizza was very crunchy and tasty...and sizzler was also spicy and good in taste...
Confused Identity was a cooler of lichi and apple juice with pepsi on top... and was lip smacking...
Hot Dark Chocolate was served as hot liquid chocolate and cream and Marsmellows on top...
Pehla nasha was a dessert with two scoops of icecreams and one pastry cake...but how they served it, was amazing... it's written there Pehla nasha will come with a sparkle and it actually did...they lit up a sparkle cracker beside the dish... And it looked attractive... and  literally drew everyone's attention over the sparkle...
The service was also good... Even now there are some offers running...
Just for liking 2 pages in facebook (Scoop and Spice) we had 10% discount on our bill...
Overall it was a good experience having lunch over there...
#A Must Try for their winter special desserts...

Food: Its quite tasty but quantity feels less for its price especially for crispy chili baby corn or Greek salad that I had there. The cold coffee frappe was average.

Service: Service was swift but difficult to get attention of the waiters n waitresses, seemed a bit under staffed for the large floor space they enjoy.

Ambiance. Pretty good usually. On weekends its pretty crowded ¬†so it might be difficult to get a seat. But there's lot of space to wait around!

Verdict: I would recommend this place for different types of dosas, starters, and awesome desserts n sizzlers.

I would like to differ with the rating of 3.2 on Zomato!
The location is fantastic, bang in the middle of new market in the street food (momore, tea junction) alley.
I had visited on 5th Jan. They had a beautiful and very tempting Christmas special menu! U r not hungry if you look at the menu display outside and still don't step in. 
We ordered the Hot Nutella, Hot Pinky, Granz Trotter soup and the lassi.
The hot nutella was delicious ! Too much calories but worth it. The only issue was the Trotter soup had no marrow as promised but chunks of mutton. The taste took me back to the perfect Irish stew. Hence no complains!

##

2015-11-16 22:50:06
Arka Mukherjee
31486541
4.0
I have been here twice and on both occasions I was quite satisfied with the food served. It is located near New Market and even though I have tried only a handful of other restaurants in the area, I think its safe to say that there is no other restaurant nearby that serves as many items, available on the menu, as over here. It has everything from north Indian to Chinese, south Indian to Italian, continental and of course the most important DESSERTS. The last one is their speciality but I will come to it later. The ambience is really good and the restaurant is quite spacious and the staffs who take orders and serve foods, are probably among the best in Kolkata, they are all really young and quite smart and really quick in taking orders and serving up the food, the place is usually full at lunch hours but even at peak hours their service is top notch, but that's not the best thing about scoop, it's their desserts that really makes this place stand out. The last time I visited the place I had fried chicken(which was really delicious and crisp), special mix noodles(which was also pretty good) but the best thing was the sundae that I had ordered, the moonrocker, this thing was out of this world, they offer a wide variety of sundaes and even other regular ice creams, if one is visiting the new market and wants to grab a quick brunch or wants to have some of the best ice creams served any where in Kolkata, then this is the place.

##

2015-11-05 23:44:56
Yajnaseni Banerjee
2427828
3.5
One of my fondest memories of ice cream is associated with scoop! Way back then, the decor was a little more sombre with mellow lights. And the tutti frutti was the best. But they have kept pace with changing times and taste and how! 
The decor is vibrant and happy hues dominate with mirrored walls.
Honestly, ice cream is not a novelty. Yet what sets scoop apart is the generous add ons and the presentation. If you are a chocolate fanatic definitely try pehla nasha and puppy love- a thoroughly chocolate bonanza. If you are looking for other flavours, tutti fruity or banana splitz will please you!
Apart from ice creams they serve pretty good french fries and thin crust pizzas!

##

2015-10-14 14:48:31
Purbali Mukherjee
30555170
4.0
Location: At the Heart of Esplanade, right opposite Sreeram Arcade and between KFC and Domino's pizza.
Ambience: Owing to its location, Scoop is always full!! The lights and the cute frames on the walls add a vibrant charm to the place.
Food: I have had a lot of dishes from their menu, and I havent had anything which wasn't tasty! Their pasta (both white and red saucs) , noodles (chicken and mixed) and biriyani are tasty. But best are the main course chicken dishes and their desserts.

Con: Their only deficiency is their staff. Most of the staff have a 'don't care' attitude and you need to call for 5/6 waiters before one of them comes to attend you. This aspect of the place is very annoying. And I guess the staff need to learn to be polite and promt!

Besides this, a Foodie will surely love Scoop!

##

2015-10-05 17:56:53
Satarupa Hajra
32057172
3.5
Scoop is a great place to hang out with friends or family. It is a young, hip, zippy and colourful one. The place is located right underneath the New Empire at Esplanade. The menu is variegated. Well ot indeed proffers different South Indian, North Indian, Bengali and Chinese cuisines that we all by and large do come across at several other restaurants. But the TRP of this place lies in its range of desserts and juices. The range is good and they are experimental. Also the facts that the price is cheaper and located around the New Market shopping area, it can be touted a more favourable destination for mostly shoppers. The people intending to have only quick snacks can also head for this place.
P.S The toilet above that is usable for restaurant-goers is not at all good. It's unclean and not even scarcely maintained. Another problem one may encounter is that the restaurant gets really populated by evening so one may have to get one's feet in a queue.

##

2015-10-04 18:48:23
Oyndrila Majumder
2465282
3.0
A friend insisted that we try out this place to grab a quick lunch. I really loved the ambiance and the decor of the place. It was full of colors and packed with excited faces and quirky furniture. The french fries with the mayonnaise was crispy and the quantity was much more than I had expected. We also had pop chicken which was crunchy outside, and soft and juicy inside. The chicken as well as the batter was extremely flavorful and the hot sauce complemented it perfectly. I would definitely recommend this even though I felt that compared to the price, the quantity was less. The woktossed veg hakka noodles with the fresh veges, also tasted pretty good. There were lots of staff present but even then we had to call them about three or four times before they attended to us and this happened a couple of times. Their behavior was also pretty cold. They made us wait for a very long time even though people who arrived after us were served promptly. All in all I would love to go there again for the ice cream but I hope the staff are more courteous.

The vibrant colours and lights  used to beautify the interiors is very refreshing and make the ambience very nice. Choice of food items being plenty, you can choose from Chinese, Continental, Indian Tandoor or South Indian dishes. Yesterday it was a rainy day,and after my day-long shopping escapade with my family, i chose Scoop to chill and satiate our hungry souls. We ordered Masala Dosas, Plain Dosas, Veg Chilly Garlic Noodles and Non Veg Chilly Garlic Noodles. They also serve Chicken Dosas by the way, which I tried long bck..and liked it too. The filling of chicken keema inside the dosa is actually.too much.to finish. Yesterday's food was decent, but the Aloo filling in Masala Dosas was rather less. The Noodles, both Veg and Non Veg were great, however. Spicy, and full.of chicken, my Non Veg Chilly Garlic Noodles were awesome, and I had no reason to complain for what I ordered. The behavior of staff was nice too as they refilled our glasses of water almost instaneously. After paying the bill, also got a discpunt card for my next.visit. :)

2015-06-11 23:53:22
PROMITA GHOSH
16192666
3.5
This is one of those colourful and pretty places you don't come across often. Located at the Lindsay street in the New Market, this big joint is a treat for the eyes. The beautiful display of colours in their lights and ceilings and pretty chair and tables make Scoop a delightful place. I love scoop and i don't actually remember how many times I paid visit to this eatery. They have a multitude of dishes ranging from Italian to chinese bites as well as desserts which make you go ga ga. I love the pastas from here as well as the chinese dishes. I have never tried south indian from here so cannot recommend. This is a total value for money joint. But if you come here do try the pastas and desserts! They'll make your day. Btw do not forget to click pictures when you come (you'll know why once you visit Scoop). :)

##

2015-06-09 13:00:50
Saunak Basu
262797
3.0
Scoop is primarily known for the Ice Cream of highest order it has been serving for decades now..Today amidst so many bakeries,desert joints this place may have lost its vigour partly but I remember from my childhood days this place was one of the Leading Ice Cream Players in the city..even today I prefer the classical flavours of ice creams served here..If I am not wrong till a point of time they used to serve primarily veg delicacies but nowadays they do serve some pretty tasty non-veg dishes as well.I would recommend to go for their starters and continental dishes.. Coming to the ambiance it is quite spacious and colourful giving it a modern,funky look..The seating arrangements are more like any Global food chains, so nothing classy about it..the service is prompt and servers are well informed it seems.. Coming to the food I never actually had a full course meal here,most of the time it is about some quick nibbles with Milk Shakes or Ice Creams before catching up for a movie at New Empire..I personally adore the Milk Shakes served here,quite refreshing..also I loved the momos the cook,actually quite tasty and filling..I would recommend the BBQ sandwich, the Chicken Pizza,Chicken Sizzler..They also serve some decent enough South Indian dishes..Personally I feel their Chinese spread is decent while their Indian spread is indifferent..Go for the Ice Cream specially,that holds the charm of this place..Do try their special Sundae.
Food: 3/5
Pricing: 3/5
Service: 3.5/5
Ambiance: 3/5

##

2015-05-21 09:26:45
Poumita Das
2810584
4.0
One of my closest friend got placed recently and hence it was treat time. It was a sultry n blisteringly hot Sunday noon. We entered at about 1 O' clock. Four hungry lions.?
We decided to skip starters as there is not much option to choose from. Now this is one area where scoop needs to improve.

Coming to the main course my foodie friend Shubharthi opted for fried fish which came with with boiled veggies, chips and a lip smacking dip. I don't know its name neither do I know what was it made of. All I know is that it tasted amazing. Recommended?Hell yes..
I went for a simple chicken steak. Thankfully the chicken was well cooked and so was the veggies. And it came with bread rolls as i do not prefer rice. Only drawback was that they had sprinkled too much of pepper in the steak. It tasted more like a stew than a steak. Not recommended.
Other two could not decide what to choose so I thought baked pasta would be a good idea but the waitor informed it would take 45mins. We immediately discarded the idea n asked for pizza. Sadly it was not available. So we went for the signature dish chicken ala king and a chicken sizzler. Chicken sizzler contained chicken mutton fish and a poached egg and rice.Quite simple and well prepared. Chicken ala king was a bit disappointing. It contained pitiful amounts of boneless chicken almost lost in the sea of cheese. No complaint about the taste though. However we were not quite satisfied so we ordered a basil noodles with prawn. It was the best main course. The noodles tasted out of the world and me being a die hard Chinese lover could not keep my hands off the plate. The prawns were a little bit undercooked but the amazing taste and flavour made up for it.

For desserts we had Tiramisu and chocolate brownie with vanilla ice cream. I had never had Tiramisu before and just loved it. Recommended.
The brownie was disappointing to say the least. It was too dry and had a bitterish taste. Do not go for it even if u see other people trying it.
Overall ambiance is nice and this place is cheap as dirt. Service is a bit slow.

A 3.5 it would have been but the plus .5 for the colorful decor. Its one of those places we Bengali's refer to as "Mon valo Kore dewa jayga".

Not one of those places for having fine dining or going back twice. But a very pocket friendly place for hanging out with friends. Thumbs up Scoop :-)
With

I woudn't say the prices are reasonable but they aren't on the high side either...
Worth trying once...

2015-03-20 15:19:05
Sahana Nandy
1932508
1.5
In a busy area like New Market, Scoop from outside comes as a delight in terms of their seating arrangements and decor. But Food - Highly NOT Recommended! I with my colleague read the reviews and thought of trying food here since our office is nearby.

We had ordered for Chicken spring roll, Chicken cheese burger, Chicken Steak. All three seemed to be stale. The burger had chicken which was over cooked and it took away my entire teeth strength to chew. Steak was a very pale preparation. Lacked taste.

What was good about food - is the dessert part. We ordered for Pehla Nasha ice cream and Choco mud cake. The ice cream was normal and tasty. The cake was to die for. My 1.5 points go only for the cake. I might go again to the restro to just try their dessert section and specially mud cake.

Our bill was 920 and it was just not worth as the food was very disappointing.

One more thing they need to work on is - order timing, we waited for more than half hour just for our starter to reach us and also the music was just too loud Couldn't hear even what the person sitting opposite to me is saying.

My first time experience in Scoop was definitely not as I had expected!

2015-03-20 12:43:38
Vikramjit Dutta
965332
4.0
your quick grab a bite joint in the new market area, which gives you that extra bit of service and quality at no extra cost!

My first visit to this place on midweek off day. I had a few things to buy from new market, and this proved to be the ideal no frills, pocket friendly choice of eatery in area. ¬†

The decor is too pink for my personal liking & looks like a barbie doll house.¬†
The food is reasonably priced and freshly served.

My friend opted for the spaghetti in white sauce/garlic bread/coke from the penny saver options. This, they got completely wrong and came with very little white sauce & a lot of green chillis/ red chilli flakes. Was taken back & the correct dish was dished out after another ten minute wait.¬†

I ate the chicken steak in pepper sauce which came with veggies and 2 bread rolls on the side.¬†

The hostess at the gate was friendly and promptly seated us as per choice. Unexpected in an eatery in this price bracket. The order taker was courteous ¬†as well, and informed us of the wait period of our order.

The place seems to be catering to budget tourists & young couples out on a budget date. Did I mention the couple at the next table ordered biryanis & the portions were enormous - ' beraal o dingiye jete paarbena ', as most bengalis would put it!

They also have screens above most tables, advertising slides of their current promos.

2015-03-18 10:10:24
Tanwyee Ray
402819
4.5
Well again a sudden plan of shopping with my college friend to new market. A weekday afternoon and it was too hot and humid outside. But yes.. Hats off to our indomitable energy. But then, we were too hungry and tired after shopping. We decided to drop in this joint when we noticed it from a distance. We occupied a table for two. The restaurant was quite crowded at that time, also being in a prime location it has to be so. Very nice, colorful interior with multi colored lighting. A large air conditiined space occupied by various types of comfortable designer seating arrangements. Some portraits are hanging from the wall. The pillars having colorful leaf and flower motif was an added attraction. Ambiance average. We ordered double fried lamb wrap, chicken ala king, pepsi. Chicken ala king was awesome and i didn't expect it would be this good here. The wrap was amazing and very spicy and hot. The outer cover was nothing but a roti and served with extra hot tomato sauce dip. And we had to order a dessert to cool ourselves down since pepsi was not enough. We noticed this pehla nasha on the menu. I just loved it. Black forest pastry was served with two scoops of vanilla ice cream with lots of chocolate sauce. It soothed our mouth and relieved us from the hotness. Service was good and price is very pocket friendly.

##

2015-03-11 11:08:41
Shamoita Bose
334351
3.0
I have visited Scoop several time and my experience over the years have eld me to believe that Scoop is a very inconsistent place to eat at. The decor is very vibrant and bright with colourful chairs. The ceilings are brightly done and the whole place is a mix of multi-chromatic decorations. They have a huge menu and they usually have moat of it available. They have an Indian section, Chinese, Continental, a range of Ice creams and Sundaes and Desserts. They also have combo meals. 
The food presentation is also very tasteful, however the food is not that good. Sometimes they live up to the expectation and plate up delicious food, the next time you order the quality is not the same. The quantity is also inconsistent and most of the times it is less than it should be. Luckily at times I have received good food whether Chinese or Continental, however most of the times I have been disappointed. Their Sundaes are nice and the Ice creams are nicely flavoured and well presented. I have tries their Creamy white sauce pasta which is moderately good. Crispy fried Pepper Mushrooms are sometimes nice and crisp at the other times soft and tasteless. There has also been an incident where my pasta had a baby cockroach in it. When I pointed it out to them they took it away and didn't charge for the dish. They had a Philadelphia Cheesecake on offer which wasn't really a cheesecake. 
Service is a little clumsy and late. Overall I have had mixed experience with Scoop.

2015-02-03 12:34:52
Rhitabrita Mukherjee
10796051
4.0
Visited the place again. .this time for more than only the Sundaes.
Located in the new market area in a place where most of the food joints are. Its a bright place with the fluorescent colours reigning , find it quite cheerful. This time we went in after a shopping trip . .very hungry. We ordered Jap chicken , a fish+French fries+ Pepsi combo and a sundae -- Pehla Nasha.
The Jap chicken was good . .a little different in taste (in a good way) but was too little in amount or rather size, but loved the sauce.
We had to wait a long time for the fish and chips but if I may say so,it was well worth the wait. In fact it was so good, the thinly crusted but crunchy fish fillets and fries , that we ordered another.
The sundae was as usual a good one with a black forest pastry and scoops of blind love ice cream but the scoops too have shrunk in size. Disappointing !
All in all the food is good but really think that they should improve the service ,try not to make the customers have to remind them again and again of the order. Also the food is a bit overpriced for the amount and the quality.

4.0
A nice joint with a quick service....at a great location, the heart of the city. I went with my wife and a friend and we ordered chicken club sandwich, french fries and a regular very cheesy chicken pizza from ¬†the menu...was served in about 6-7 minutes...and almost perfectly made...i wished a little more color and crispness of the breads but taste wise, there is not a bit of disappointment...layered with cheese and fried eggs...mashed chicken and juicy tomatoes and cucumbers...and the portion size was huge...it was a combo snack with french fries and they actually serve french fries comparable with McDonalds...long sleek and crisp cuts of carbohydrates....the only improvement area was the salad that the gave along with it...probably they would call it a coleslaw but i would say its a coleslaw which is 2 days old left outside the freezer...better not to serve that...the cheesy pizza was served over a wooden pizza peel...was nicely baked with right amount of cheese...

2014-11-25 18:23:05

848681
3.0
Have visited this place quite a lot,because less of family restaurant in New Market area.

Very colorful restaurant - colorful chairs,lights and decor.They serve almost everything, be it south Indian,north Indian,Mughlai,Chinese,Continental and Cold beverages.

But let me tell you,choose the dishes very carefully because most of them taste lack of authenticity.

In my several visits, I have tasted many items.Sometimes¬† Kashmiri Polao,Shahi Korma,sometimes Special Mix Noodles¬† with Chicken side dishes,Sometimes Chicken Sizzler/Chef's Special Veg Sizzler,but most of the times Sundae(Specially Tutti Fruity).

None of them was extra-ordinary in taste,just a typical form of the authentic dishes.

Every items are good in quantity(not in quality).Tutty Fruity is exceptional.

But even after so many negatives, the main plus point is location and item options.

Thus Scoop remain a popular destination in Esplanade area

2014-11-18 15:58:42
Darpa Narayan S
1617754
4.0
The moment you enter this joint the first thing that strikes your eye is the vibrant sympohony of colors all around. It seems like you have come inside a rainbow surrounded by clouds. The decor of this place is striking and just a eye candy that gives you a soothing sensation. This place is located near the new empire cinema of new market. This was a place which created a food court type environment even before the shopping mall culture came to town. They offer almost everything ranging from salads, pasta, pizzas, chinese dishes, kabab platers, even simple maggi noodles, ice creams, juices, shakes etc. You name it and this scarlet red place has got everything to make your mood. One of the most important point supporting this joint is their reasonable price which could be adjustable to everyone's budget. Hence if you are near by new market area and looking for something rather than typical street foods in a reasonable budget then "scoop" is your destination.

After a hectic exam me and my pals were dead hungry and decided to give the utmost pleasure to  our stomach at scoop. The interior is large and nicely decorated. We were a pack of 6 people and luckily got one of the tables to sit . After a huge discussion we ordered an  indo ‚Äìchinese mixed menu in the starter section :P It was Fried wantons, chilly garlic basil prawn, Tandoori fish and Tandoori murg followed by diet pepsi . The starters were yummilicious specially the prawns with a zesty touch and the other ones were flavorful too. The Tandoori fish was succulent and immensely spicy. We  literally wanted to lick our fingers but unfortunately we couldn‚Äôt do so. The main course came after a short while & it had Grilled fish, Cantonese noodles (non veg) Flaming chilly prawns, Indonesian shrimp fried rice and spicy chilly chicken. The Cantonese noodles is too healthy with steamed veggies making it very appetizing and even the grilled fish was delectable. I personally found the prawn dishes are above praise worthy, the tastiest prawns I ever had. The fried rice and chilli chicken was also good ,nothing extraordinary but  I found the quantity was little less. The staffs are well behaved and the service too was up to the mark. It is obviously recommendable for  atleast once but  for prawn lovers - twice, thrice or more.

Visited this one on the very first day of Durga Puja, and my experience was just horrible, and I literally mean it. First when we entered the restaurant i really liked the ambiance, it was full of vibrant colours and soothing music, we got a table for three of us. Then the main part starts, first we were sitting just unattended for half an hour, even nobody came with a glass of water. Then after calling thrice one lady came to take the order. After placing the order we were chatting and suddenly the lady who took the order came with some plates and spoon and and literally dumped on our table, we were really shocked with this kind of attitude, though all of us were in festive mood we ignored this. Then one guy came with the order and just left the bowls and left, there was no one to at least arrange the plates, whatever we were hungry at that time so helped each other. The food was ok , but I found the quantity a little less according to the price (You can get sufficient amount for 2 people in any restaurant in China Town at lower price). But there were more surprises waiting for us, we asked for water and the same lady who took our order came and she accidentally overfilled "TWO" glasses ( I don't know how it could be possible ), and didn't even apologized for that. Then we noticed something was floating in one of the glasses, we asked the lady to change the glass and she surprisingly asked us what is the thing floating, we took a close look and found some small onion like thing, then she asked how that thing gone in the glass and by her tone it was clearly reflecting that she was trying to mean that if we are responsible for this or not, then by gods grace she replaced the glass. We quickly finished the food and paid the bill and left the place as soon as possible. Truly speaking this place just spoiled our mood for the whole day, and I would never ever recommend any of my friends.

Scoop at New Market is an awesome place to visit after a hectic day of shopping and chill in the air condition. The interior is huge and pretty well decorated. There are both male and female waiters to take the order and serve you. Though it is a spcious restaurant yet you will find it full most of the time given its proximity to new market and shreeram arcade located on the opposite. They serve everything from a thali to continental to south indian ¬†to italian and english. They also have a wide variety of desserts and shakes. Overall its a wonderfull place to chilla and experience good food.

1.0
I have been wanting to visiting Scoop for quite some time after watching its colorful interiors from KFC. Visited the place last Friday with mum and sister after shopping. We entered the place at around 3 and there were a few empty seats on the ground floor. While we were about to sit, a lady directed us upstairs. We had no idea what a mistake we are making by going upstairs.

We were directed to sit on a table right infront of the door. The AC was either too low or absent upstairs. Not nice. The waitress arrived to take our orders. She had that constant eyebrow lifted expression with so much attitude that it would instantly irritate you. We ordered Chole Bhature and Capsicum Utthapam. She asked if we wanted mineral water with the same rude tone. When I said she could serve serve plain water, man! you should seen the reaction when she just said 'we dont serve plain water'. Well, the restaurant rules can differ and it is alright but atleast be polite. What the hell! So the Queen waitress marched off telling us it would take a minimum of 30 minutes :/

The food arrived at around 3:40. Three friends left from a table beside us after the snooty behavior of the same queen waitress. The chole bhature was good to my relief! My sister was quite pleased with her food till she found a small stone in her food (picture follows). I was not surprised by now. My Capsicum Utthapam was nothing great. It was not bad either.¬†

The worst part was there was a room (store room) right in front. They brought in the food from downstairs and kept it inside that room before serving it to everyone for some reasons. So what is so bad about it? Well, the room had a broomstick and a corner all red with paan stains (picture follows). This room was right opposite to my chair and after one view of it, I could not gulp down my food. I mean how can you keep the food which has paan saliva? Where is the hygiene factor? Yuck!

We also had to ask for tissue papers as they were not provided otherwise. There was a sweet guy who served us food. Finally a relief from the other rude waitress. However, I would never recommend this place to anyone. There are just colorful interiors, just on the ground floor and that is all that I liked here.

So, quite a disappointment we had. And I am never going back again. Period.

##

2014-08-24 13:31:20
Shiladitya Sarkar
384424
2.0
Was in this area after ages...thanks to a bunch of friends who decided to go shopping on Saturday evening. The area was teeming with people as expected and the weather was sultry to say the least. We choose Scoop for some air-conditioning comfort. On entering we were told to wait for 5 minutes near a gate. The lady was sweet and a glance revealed the place was filled with hungry shoppers...some with family and some with their partners!

Got a table by the promised time for the five of us. We wanted to order momo and some chinese snacks (and it was evening time) but the waiter politely told us that Chinese and Indian dishes would take around half an hour to arrive and continental  or south indian was the only option because of the rush. We took his word and ordered a large "Yum Yum Yummy" pizza and "As you like it" Ice cream. The pizza arrived in 15 minutes and was not served on a regular tray but 3 side dishes with three slices each instead. The pizza was not so yummy as it sounded even after we put lots of oregano and chili flakes! The chicken toppings were small and I could not find much vegetables either. As requested, the ice cream was served right after we polished off the pizza. It did live up to scoop's reputation, served in a huge bowl with different flavors like butterscotch, vanilla and chocolate complete with nuts and fruits. It did make up for the pizza disappointment.

A note on the interiors. I noticed the false ceiling in certain parts of the restaurant in a pretty bad shape although the place looks bright with a lot of colours and plastic furniture which gives the place a young feel. The air conditioning was terrible considering the fact that it was full and the weather was extremely sultry outside. And finally, while leaving we saw puke lying on the floor which was unattended to (it seemed for sometime). Yuk!

2014-07-21 17:53:02
Abhinav Acharya
1999898
4.0
What do I say about this place... Its one place I always try to go whenever I visit kolkata. Located in esplanade, near the new market area surrounded by many fast food joints and restaurants. But this place stands apart in the crowd. Well atleast when one enters the restaurant. Has a very nice ambience,neat funky decor. And a courteous staff. I have been told that they even given discounts to all-women customers. The place is spacious and houses a modest crowd at any given time. They recommend us to book in advance. Now to the food. Well they have a good variety of cuisines which include indian, Chinese and other oriental dishes. They keep changing their menus from time to time and they also keep special menus for special occasions. I like their smoothies, and among the main course the reshmi chicken, the tandoori variety and pulaos are my favourites. I would recommend anyone living in Kolkata or anyone nearby to try out this place at least once.

##

2014-07-09 17:25:17
Ujwal Choudhary
1054168
1.5
Location: New Market

Gone are those days when one used to go on a shopping round at new market and made it a point to drop by at Scoop for a quick bite or a full-fledged meal. 
Scoop is located right beside the New Empire which was quite famous in the good old days for the screening of English movies that were released here. 
The ambiance out here is quite colourful and as you enter it would simply cheer up up. 
But, sadly this happiness is quite short lived and is taken over by a grumpy face as soon as you seat yourself. Yes, uncomfortable seats.

This place has anyway taken it's shortcut to oblivion with the help of the rude servers, near to average food across all cuisines they have on offer and last but not the least the stench that overshadows the room fresheners they spray! 

This place used to be one of my favorites in those early days but, a recent visit with the most disgusting experience rendered this place to be a strict no-no for me. 

What made the experience bad? 
-A smelly place altogether. 
-Drinking water not being served even after reminders.
-Food portions do not justify the prices. 
-Bill given along with the meal. :\ 
-Rude Staff and too busy doing nothing.
-Instead of accepting that the food wasn't upto the mark, silly excuses are given, out which the excuse that tops the list is "This dish is made like this". I mean, c'mon, we customers aren't fools. 

Good experiences turned bad! :\

One star from me.
+0.5 for all the old times this place made me come back for more.

3.0
I have been here quite a few times since my childhood but never retained any information so write a review on it. Finally I went here today after a long time and I was surprised by the way this place has changed. They seem to have revamped the place with a lot of neon lighting and funky decor. They also have free wifi now. The first thing that took me by surprise was the very loud music. Loud enough to irritate you a bit. We were then seater soon and we ordered for a 'Paradise Found' Ice cream and another tutti fruiti along with a Pepsi, a plate of chicken steamed momos and a chilly chicken dry. I disliked their service especially because we werent served water for about 20mins since our arrival. We had asked for it 4 times but in vain. It finally arrived at our table along with the ice creams. The tutti fruiti was great and so was the paradise found, scoop has been popular of its ice cream anyway. Then we got served our main snacks, the momos were good but the chilly chicken was mediocre, could have been better and again we were served the Pepsi when we were almost through our snacks. The total came upto 754, I still dont understand why a glass of pepsi which is Rs.10 (the glass bottle) costs Rs.55 not just here but mostly everywhere. Anyway so the service is quite poor as you can read. Orelse the place is good for a friendly hangout and some munchies in between shopping sprees. Though there are many options to eat oit here but this one is worth a shot. Happy eating.

On asking the waiter, he said that the platter has changed. I requested for a proper sizzler. I was made to wait for 30 odd minutes when all the waiters had a small meeting and no one bothered to serve our desk. And then had to call a waiter for the bill for the remaining food. Such a bad experience for a regular customer ! Disgusting ! They change platter randomly, but their floor manager is not aware off ! And they expect me to believe that lie ! Had I gone by the reviews here, I would have definitely ordered the usual good ones here, but I settled for a different menu. I ordered Cheese masala Dosa and Onion uttapam as the main course dishes. I was not alone, have a tiny tummy.
Chilly babycorn- Disaster No.1 , It wasn't even properly cooked!!! Some were tender , some hard, some were fresh, some tasted stale, and to add to the woes, the quantity was an awful lot. Not that I would have complained had it been good.

Cheese Masala Dosa- Just putting cheese ,masala inside the dosa: that's how they define it here. I have never tried this item. i don't know if the cheese is supposed to stay and taste alongwith the masala or just like the lumps of masala and cheese as it tasted. but whatever it was, this takes the count to disaster no. 3.
Net result: The hangover of my comfort food -Schewan momo I had before this was lost , and huh, I had to write this review

Located near the bustling and jostling New Market area Scoop is a pet favourite among the shoppers, window shoppers as well as college students. I will attribute the reason to the variation of cuisine that the place has to its customers. Chinese, Continental and North Indian are some of the fundamental cuisines that go down well with the gourmet as well as the not-so foodie. The combo meals are a great option if one is looking for cost-cutting yet enjoying a meal. But the quality of the food didn‚Äôt go down with me well. The quality of food and the pricing is just done. The only thing you can savour to your delight is the sundaes. If you are tired after a strenuous shopping spree and have a hearty good quality meal in a serene ambience, then it‚Äôs better to safely avoid Scoop. It‚Äôs very noisy too! The only thing worth your attention is the spunky interiors!

2013-11-22 23:37:23
Agnipravo Sengupta

3.5
Just back home fresh from my first visit at Scoop. The location is fantastic... very easy to find. What hooked my attention when I entered the place was the decor. Simple yet elegant; especially the smart way lighting has been used over here. It gives you a very 'posh' feel.

Ice creams are famous over here... so I stuck to the basics. Ordered a Moon Rocker Sundae (I LOVE butterscotch) and a Cran Cooler Pink Me Chiller. They tasted pretty satisfying, but were quite pricey too.

Located in the same building as the more popular Kfc,Barista,Dominos the thing about this particular place that will draw your attention and make you want to give this place a try is its colourful and funky decor.At least it was so in my case.
I visited this place for the first time about 4-5 yrs ago.Back then I used to love their ice creams and sundaes.They were excellent and very decently priced too.The main course items were not as good but decent nonetheless.The menu was also quite varied.
After quite a long time,I visited this place again yesterday thanks to the heavy rain.I was surprised to see that the menu had become even more extensive.It contained alomost everything ranging from North Indian to South Indian to Chinese to Pizzas to Burgers to even Continental items.Since we were not too hungry and it was just the two of us,we ordered a Chicken ala king and  a chocolate shake.The chocolate shake was quite nice.But the chicken ala king was quite a disappointment.It took quite a long time to arrive and when it finally did arrive we were amazed at the quantity.It was pitifully small.The taste was also not the greatest.And to make matters worse,the price was quite high.In fact the prices have had a significant hike and it is higher than the menu on zomato.Unfortunately,I felt that while the prices have gone one way,the quality of the food has gone the other way.
Coming to the ambience,as I mentioned already,it has a uniquely colourful and funky decor.It is may be a bit too colourful.It is the first thing you would notice about the place.They provide seating in chairs which are colourful but not too comfortable.The place is always crowded and there is always a busy feel about the place which for me makes it quite unsuitable for fine dining or a date.Its quite okay though if you visit in a group.The staff are friendly but the service is on the slower side except the desserts and sundaes.
Overall I feel this is a place which has a lot of potential.But at present,if at all I were to make a recommendation about this place I would suggest the sundaes and desserts only.

##

1262333
3.5

Food - The food is reasonably priced. A long list of preparations were available in the menu. Ordered a pizza which tasted good and was filling. Will have to visit again to try out more from their menu.

2013-09-11 21:58:55
Tarun
1155456
2.0
Scoop is located in building that also hosts the new empire amidst that busy new market area. It used to be on the agenda when there weren't many multiplexes and new empire used to showcase the few english movies that would realease here and there weren't any kfc or a dominos nearby. Its got a colorful decor but very okayish. The seats are not so comfortable for me atleast. The staff service is not so great either.

The menu is elaborate and one could get almost anything like north indian, chinese, italian, burgers, sizzlers, ice creams................But i would stick to their ice creams and sundaes alone 2 years back but now even for the ice creams i would go for a cream and fudge counter located just in front of scoop.

The prices are not so reasonable compared to the park street restaurants. The quality of food is very ok for such prices. I find the chinese food pretty average, sizzlers below average. indian food is ok though. The burger is the fat old indianised one which is ok but nothing as compared to one served at cafe corner at similar price. Ice cream sundaes make up for the damage done but not so much to warrant another visit.

2013-05-25 18:10:34
Niladri Chakraborty
775182
3.5
I visit this place frequently with friends. Factors that attract us are:

1) Low price
2) Good Taste (We love the crunchy shakes in summer and kebabs are just awesome)
3) The colourful, but not too bright atmosphere, is a turn on. (Makes us feel younger and nostalgic)
4) Staff is good - quite attentive
5) Not so posh. So you can eat and chat with your companion (s) in your own way
6) Perfect location
7) The seating arrangements are fine

Scoop is the perfect choice for anyone who goes to Esplanade area frequently and fancies an affordable tasty meal if he or she feels ravenous about it.

I don't recommend chicken nuggets. Try the light, soft and palatable kebabs there (my personal favourite). You may try the cold nourishments available there too, especially, in summer.

2013-03-26 00:10:56
Poorna Banerjee
2686
1.5
I went there the other day for Nostalgia's sake and was thoroughly disappointed. The entire place stank of fish... more specifically, fried fish which had gone slightly stale before frying and hence smelled when it was being fried. We sat down and after 10 minutes one female waitress came in and took our order with all the snootiness of the Queen of Sheba. Needless to say, we were not impressed. We ordered a pasta and a fried chicken dish because we were hungry, and the girl told us repeatedly about some stuff or the other, which were more expensive. When we told her firmly we wanted this order, she was quite rude and flounced off. 

After 10 minutes, she got our food in, and my friend was dismayed to see the measly five small pieces of chicken in the plate with 2 cucumber and 1 slice of carrot. For 150/- or so, she did not expect this. On the other hand, the pasta was decently proportioned. 

The bad part came after this - halfway down our meal, the waitress actually put down the bill in front of us. This was clearly bad manners, and we could see that the restaurant still had at least 4 empty tables, and there was no reason for her to be rude. Annoyed, we paid, and marched away. Sorry but I am not coming back here.

You go to new market for shopping and you feel like dropping into some place to eat, the place should definitely be scoop. The have a wide variety of items on the menu card- soup for the winters, ice-creams and cold drinks for the summers. They have things for proper lunch, dinner and very cheap too. Drop in at any time you wan and you will definitely get the best to munch on.
One of my friends had told me about scoop and that's why I dropped in. The interiors are too lively, the staff is quite responsive and best of all the food tastes amazing. It was the best I ever had.The french fries were amazing- perfect colour, perfect aroma and the perfect crispness. It was quite a cheap deal and we had made the most out of it.
We ended out dine out with deserts- " As you like it". The most expensive on the chart but the best.I would love coming to this place again an again.

##

2013-03-06 17:18:50
Angi C
73425
4.5
New Empire's been around a long time, but Scoop packs quite a punch. The place is very noticeable from the outside, because of it's bright, cheery exteriors and seems to magnetically attract weary shoppers from New Market. 

The ambience is bustling, and fast. With quite a load of tables, this is the quintessential quick fast food joint. The menu has something to fit everyone - whether you're looking for a Continental bite, a long-drawn Indian meal or just a sundae - this place has all of it. The sundaes are extremely good, as are the dosas. Good food at pretty good rates, perfect to refresh oneself after a long hard day. 

The service is also pretty fast, looking at the number of patrons it gets everyday. The final verdict - a great joint to rev up the appetite, if you're tired and in the area.

2013-02-25 06:14:07
Arnab De
438332
3.0
I used to visit this place quite often with my friends during my school and college days. I still remember the days when New Empire and The Globe used to be the paradise for English movie buffs. The multiplex culture was not significant back then. I would be wrong if I say this place is a delight for culinary senses. This is a pretty ordinary restaurant with average food. It is an ideal place for the students to save the pocket money. The place is very noisy as well. However, unlike few other restaurants in the New Market area, it is comparatively more hygienic. You may want to try out their desserts and mocktails. You won't be disappointed. However, I would not prefer this place for a lunch or dinner if I am in Kolkata for few days. I'd be heading towards Park Street instead !! :)
